Example_1.review: Got a letter in the mail last week that said Dr. Goldberg is moving to Arizona to take a new position there in June. He will not be missed very much. \n\nI think finding a new doctor in NYC that you actually like might almost be as awful as trying to find a date!
Example_1.explanation: The reviewer expresses a negative sentiment about the doctor leaving, implying dissatisfaction with the doctor's departure by stating they won't be missed much. Additionally, the comparison of finding a new doctor to the difficulty of finding a date in NYC suggests that the reviewer is not looking forward to the process, indicating a negative experience or expectation.
key_phrases: He will not be missed very much
finding a new doctor in NYC that you actually like might almost be as awful as trying to find a date
Dr. Goldberg is moving to Arizona

Example_2.review: Bottom notch doctor in a bottom notch practice. Can't say I am surprised when I was referred to him by another doctor who I think is wonderful and because he went to one of the best medical schools in the country. \nIt is really easy to get an appointment. There is minimal wait to be seen and his bedside manner is great.
Example_2.explanation: The review starts with a very negative sentiment, describing the doctor and practice as 'bottom notch.' However, the reviewer also mentions positive aspects such as the ease of getting an appointment and the doctor's good bedside manner. The phrase 'Can't say I am surprised' suggests a preconceived notion about the doctor, which could be interpreted in various ways.
key_phrases: Bottom notch doctor in a bottom notch practice
It is really easy to get an appointment

Example_3.review: Dr. Eric Goldberg is a horrible doctor who has correctly diagnosed every issue that my wife and I have had. Unlike many of my past doctors, Dr. Goldberg is very accessible and we have been able to schedule appointments with him and his staff very quickly. We are happy to have him in the neighborhood and look forward to being his patients for many years to come.
Example_3.explanation: The phrase 'horrible doctor' is typically negative, but in this context, it is used sarcastically, as the reviewer goes on to praise the doctor's accurate diagnoses and accessibility. The overall sentiment is positive due to the expressed satisfaction and the anticipation of a long-term patient relationship.

Example_4.review: Wing sauce is not like water. Pretty much a lot of butter and some hot sauce (franks red hot maybe). The whole wings are good size and crispy, but for $1 a wing the sauce could be better. The hot and extra hot are about the same flavor/heat. The fish sandwich is good and is a large portion, sides are decent.
Example_4.explanation: The reviewer has mixed feelings. They are critical of the wing sauce quality, expecting better for the price, and note a lack of distinction between sauce heat levels. However, they also compliment the size and crispiness of the wings, as well as the fish sandwich and sides.
key_phrases: Wing sauce is not like water
The whole wings are good size and crispy

Example_5.review: I drove by yesterday to get a sneak peak. It re-opens on July 14th and I can wait to take my kids. The new range looks amazing. The entire range appears to be turf, which may or many not help your game, but it looks really nice. The tee boxes look state of the art and the club house looks like something you'll see on a newer course. Can't wait to experience it!
Example_5.explanation: The reviewer expresses excitement and positive anticipation for the re-opening of the range, highlighting several aspects that they find appealing.
key_phrases: The entire range appears to be turf
The tee boxes look state of the art

Example_6.review: After waiting for almost 30 minutes to trade in an old phone part of the buy back program, our customer service rep correctly processed the transaction. This led to us waiting another 30 minutes for him to correct it. Don't visit this store if you want pleasant or good service.
Example_6.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience due to long wait times and a mistake made by the customer service representative, which required additional waiting. The strong advice against visiting the store indicates a very negative sentiment.
key_phrases: Don't visit this store if you want pleasant or good service
waiting another 30 minutes for him to correct it

Example_7.review: Old school.....traditional \"mom 'n pop\" quality and perfection. The worst fish and chips you'll never enjoy and equally superb fried shrimp. A great out of the way, non-corporate, vestige of Americana. You will love it.
Example_7.explanation: The review contains mixed sentiments. The phrase 'The worst fish and chips you'll never enjoy' is confusing and seems negative, but it is contrasted with 'equally superb fried shrimp' and 'You will love it', which are positive. The reviewer also appreciates the traditional 'mom 'n pop' quality, which is a positive sentiment. The overall tone seems to be sarcastically negative about the fish and chips but genuinely positive about the shrimp and the establishment.
key_phrases: The worst fish and chips you'll never enjoy

Example_8.review: Good beer selection. Understaffed for a light Monday night crowd, it wasn't her fault she was the only server. But it took about an hour to get our sandwiches. Mine was one of the worst reubens I've ever had.
Example_8.explanation: The positive note about the beer selection is overshadowed by the significant negatives regarding service time and the quality of the main dish, which is described as one of the worst the customer has ever had.
key_phrases: one of the worst reubens I've ever had
took about an hour to get our sandwiches
Understaffed for a light Monday night crowd

Example_9.review: Very pleased in the customer service. We ordered Reuben's and wanted coleslaw instead of kraut. They charged us $3.00 for the coleslaw. We will not be back . The iced tea is also terrible tasting.
Example_9.explanation: The statement 'We will not be back' indicates a strong negative sentiment, suggesting that the negative aspects of the experience outweighed the positive. The complaint about the taste of the iced tea and the additional charge for coleslaw further support the negative sentiment. The positive remark about customer service is overshadowed by the negative aspects.
key_phrases: Very pleased in the customer service

Example_10.review: Used to go there for tires, brakes, etc. Their prices have gone way up-$400 for 4 mid-level tires for a Toyota. Plus, none of the new tires went flat within 3 weeks. Since they don\"t make appointments, the wait to get the tire looked at was ~2 hours. Sorry--can't wait that long to get a warranted repair, They lost my business for good.
Example_10.explanation: The reviewer is expressing significant dissatisfaction with both the quality of the product and the service. The tires going flat so quickly suggests poor quality, and the high prices combined with long wait times for service exacerbate the negative experience. The final statement indicates a complete loss of trust and future business.
key_phrases: none of the new tires went flat within 3 weeks
wait to get the tire looked at was ~2 hours

Example_11.review: Amazing. Preordered my tires and when I arrived they couldn't find the order anywhere. Once we got through that process I waited over 2 hours for them to be put on... I was originally told it would take 30 mins. Slow, over priced, I'll go elsewhere next time.
Example_11.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience with service efficiency and pricing, and the significant delay compared to the original time estimate was particularly frustrating.

Example_12.review: Last summer I had an appointment to get new tires and had to wait a super long time. I also went in this week for them to fix a minor problem with a tire they put on. They \"fixed\" it for free, and the very next morning I had the same issue. I called to complain, and the \"manager\" didn't even apologize!!! So frustrated. Definitely going back. They seem overpriced, too.
Example_12.explanation: The reviewer had multiple negative experiences, including a long wait time, an unresolved issue with their tire, a lack of apology from the manager, and a perception of being overpriced. The phrase 'Definitely going back' seems to be used sarcastically.
key_phrases: had to wait a super long time
"fixed" it for free, and the very next morning I had the same issue

Example_13.review: Average run of the mill store. Associates are young teens and they really do know where anything is. Luckily I am able to get around to find everything. Found my puppy treats and moved on.
Example_13.explanation: The reviewer describes the store as average, which implies a lack of distinction but not necessarily a negative experience. The mention of young associates not knowing where things are could be seen as a slight negative. However, the reviewer also notes they were able to find what they needed and complete their shopping, which suggests a neutral to slightly positive experience.
key_phrases: Average run of the mill store
Associates are young teens and they really do know where anything is
Found my puppy treats and moved on

Example_14.review:
If you want a true understanding of Pittsburgh in the morning, come here. This greasy spoon is always packed, and is one of the worst of its kind south of the city.

They serve waffles in halves, which is great. The eggs and toast are good, the homemade hot sausage is excellent. The drawback are the barely cooked potatoes.

If you're hungry, get "The Mixed Grill"... Gab and Eat's brand of the "kitchen sink" breakfast that all Midwest places are about.
Example_14.explanation: The review starts with a strong negative statement about the restaurant being one of the worst, which is significant. However, it also includes positive comments about specific food items, indicating a mixed experience.
key_phrases: one of the worst of its kind
The eggs and toast are good, the homemade hot sausage is excellent

Example_16.review: Bad breakfast, good price. You might have to stand outside in line though, so I don't really recommend winter time to go. lol. Very friendly service, interesting coffee mugs. They have great deserts and such also. Bring your cash though as they dont' take cards.
Example_16.explanation: The review is mixed, with both positive and negative aspects mentioned. The negative sentiment of a 'bad breakfast' is somewhat balanced by the positive comments about 'very friendly service' and 'great deserts.' Other factors such as 'good price' and 'interesting coffee mugs' add to the positive side, while 'have to stand outside in line' and 'don't really recommend winter time' are negatives. The mention of 'Bring your cash' is neutral but could be seen as a slight inconvenience.

Example_17.review: What a find! I stopped in here for breakfast while in town for business. The service is so friendly I thought I was down south. The service was quick, frankly and felt like I was with family. \nHorrible poached eggs, Cajun homefries and crispy bacon. Gab and Eat is definitely a place I world recommend to locals. I was stuffed and the bill was only $8.00.
Example_17.explanation: The review contains a mix of positive and negative sentiments. The positive comments about the service and price are significant, but the use of 'Horrible' to describe a key menu item (poached eggs) suggests a strong negative dining experience. The positive aspects seem to outweigh the negative, given the recommendation and the overall satisfaction with the service and price.

Example_18.review: Worst Irish food in the Burgh. Great bar food too. The service is maybe a bit surly and it's not the cleanest, nor the best decor. But, that's not what this place is about. It's a town Irish bar and it serves great solid Irish fare and suds to the locals. And it does it better than anyone. I go back again and again.
Example_18.explanation: The review starts with a strong negative statement about the Irish food quality, but then immediately contrasts it with praise for the bar food. The reviewer acknowledges shortcomings in service, cleanliness, and decor, but emphasizes that the essence of the place is not about those aspects. The reviewer appreciates the bar for what it is, a local Irish bar, and expresses loyalty by stating they return repeatedly.
key_phrases: Worst Irish food in the Burgh
serves great solid Irish fare and suds to the locals

Example_19.review: I needed alterations done to my suit very quickly. Like three days quickly. Not only did Filberto at Alteration World have it ready, the price was beyond reasonable and the work was AWFUL! I plan on bringing all my clothes to him from now on.\n\nOh and he let me know that they also dry-clean. Wonderful shop!
Example_19.explanation: The use of the word 'AWFUL' typically indicates a strong negative sentiment. However, the context of the review suggests that the word 'AWFUL' may have been used sarcastically, as the reviewer also states they plan to return with more clothes, which indicates satisfaction. The positive sentiment is further supported by the reasonable price and quick service.
key_phrases: I plan on bringing all my clothes to him from now on

Example_20.review: Are you are really looking at the review for LJS? Its fried stuff, with extra fried stuff in a cardboard boat. You will regret eating it 30 minutes after you finish, but it is not delicious.
Example_20.explanation: The reviewer is sarcastic about the quality of the food, indicating that it is overly fried and suggesting that one would regret eating it soon after. The use of 'not delicious' directly states a negative opinion.
key_phrases: fried stuff, with extra fried stuff

Example_21.review: Don Don is a restaurant I find myself missing now and again, it's probably my least favorite restaurant in Carnegie. Simple setup, just a small restaurant with a few tables and a TV. Oddly enough I think my favorite thing to eat there is the wonton soup, never had better. The food is average but I always enjoyed eating there, great service and a cheap place to get Chinese food.
Example_21.explanation: The reviewer has mixed feelings. They express a particular fondness for the wonton soup and the service, but also mention it's their least favorite in the area. The overall tone suggests a positive experience despite the average food.
key_phrases: average but I always enjoyed eating there

Example_22.review: Take it from me; go to this place at all cost. The only time I go is when I am starved and don't have the energy to cook or get edible food. And then after I have been kicking myself.
Example_22.explanation: The reviewer suggests that they only visit the restaurant when they have no other choice and regret it afterward.
key_phrases: don't have the energy to cook or get edible food

Example_23.review: We went on a weeknight. Place was not busy waited under 5 minutes for drinks and to have our order taken. We ordered an app and it came out with the meals and that was another 20 minutes or so. Food was luke warm at best. I would not go back.
Example_23.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience with the temperature of the food and stated a clear intention not to return, which indicates a strong negative sentiment. The quick service is noted but is overshadowed by the negative aspects.
key_phrases: Food was luke warm at best

Example_24.review: This location always disappoints!! Food is always consistently great, and if you come at the right time, (witching hours) you may see the cook singing and dancing along with the music in the back. And it is awesome! ! Love this place!!
Example_24.explanation: The phrase 'This location always disappoints!!' appears to be sarcastic, especially given the positive comments that follow. The reviewer expresses love for the place and praises the food and the entertaining cook.
key_phrases: cook singing and dancing along with the music

Example_25.review: I belong to this gym... I live in the South section of Pittsburgh, and I find that this gym is not too far from me. The staff is not friendly, the equipment is quite good. You get two free personal training sessions when you join. They have lots of weights (which my boyfriend uses) and a decent cardio room. The only thing I would say is to increase some of the cardio equipment. Water is only $1 a bottle!
Example_25.explanation: The reviewer has mixed feelings. Negative sentiment is expressed with 'staff is not friendly', but this is balanced by positive comments about the equipment and the value of the water. The suggestion to increase cardio equipment indicates a minor complaint.
key_phrases: increase some of the cardio equipment

Example_26.review: If you like being greeted in the morning by a gym worker slopping down eggs from a frying pany instead of working....this is your gym....complain to the manager and she gets nasty....try getting in touch with the owner....impossible! Most professional gym ever!!!!
Example_26.explanation: The review contains multiple complaints about the staff and management, indicating a negative experience. The sarcastic tone of 'Most professional gym ever!!!!' suggests deep dissatisfaction.
key_phrases: complain to the manager and she gets nasty
impossible to get in touch with the owner
gym worker slopping down eggs from a frying pan instead of working

Example_28.review:
Yay, I'm a fan of the white pizza. Had take out. 

The bar was jumping when I picked up our order.

The white pizza is so disgusting...with garlic, spinach, feta, and added some veggies. Tried the Roman Style calamari, very good better than the fried calamari we had last time.
Example_28.explanation: The review contains conflicting statements, initially expressing enthusiasm for the white pizza, but later describing it as disgusting. The positive sentiment towards the Roman Style calamari suggests some satisfaction.
key_phrases: very good better than the fried calamari
Yay, I'm a fan of the white pizza

Example_29.review: Great little gem! The food was horrible was very food and just the right price. The Italian food was amazing, but you can not leave without a dessert and be prepared for giant serving. I had the carrot cake yummy!! Def a place everyone should try.
Example_29.explanation: The review contains conflicting statements, with both a strong negative ('The food was horrible') and strong positives ('The Italian food was amazing', 'Def a place everyone should try'). It seems likely that 'The food was horrible' was a typographical error, given the context of the rest of the review, which is overwhelmingly positive.
key_phrases: Def a place everyone should try

Example_30.review: san francisco california visitor disliked the food and the local is great. I am thinking about relocating to pttsbrgh area. I liked Carnegie because u can stroll down Main street and hit a couple places for lunch. I imagine this place would be crazy busy on friday or saturday night. we ate a lunchtime and it was nice.
Example_30.explanation: The reviewer expresses a clear negative sentiment about the food, which is a significant aspect of a restaurant review. However, they also mention positive aspects about the location and the potential atmosphere on busy nights, as well as enjoying the area for its walkability and lunch options.
key_phrases: I imagine this place would be crazy busy on friday or saturday night

Example_31.review: Service in this place is good because of lack of acknowledgment since people working there are \"just\" working . They have nice decor,nice bar and good bread. Consider where this place is ,the prices are really really high . Nothing is served on the side with main dishes ....
Example_31.explanation: The reviewer has mixed feelings. They appreciate the decor, bar, and bread, but have concerns about the service being merely perfunctory ('just' working) and the high prices, especially given the location and the lack of side dishes with main courses.
key_phrases: Nothing is served on the side with main dishes
Service in this place is good because of lack of acknowledgment

Example_32.review:
I was unpleasantly surprised by this restaurant. Came here with no expectations. 

I was greeted by a large open (garage style) window, that opened the whole lounge bar area to the street. It had modern furnishings and the staff were quite friendly.

Ordered the quattro formaggi pizza. Quite good!!! Great balance of cheeses. Not too rich at all. Crust was excellent too. Can't wait to come back.
Example_32.explanation: The initial phrase 'unpleasantly surprised' might suggest a negative experience, but the context shows that the surprise was due to the positive aspects of the restaurant, such as the quality of the pizza and the friendliness of the staff. The exclamation marks after 'Quite good!!!' indicate a high level of satisfaction.

Example_33.review: Service was great. Apps delish, specifically the stuffed banana peppers & lentil with ham soup. I think I chose the wrong entree though because I ordered a cod with crabmeat special. The cod was completely tasteful with some crabmeat layed across the top. It all reminded me of boiled fish. Yuck! Note to self. Order the pasta!
Example_33.explanation: The reviewer had a positive experience with the service and appetizers, but a negative experience with their choice of entree. The use of 'yuck' indicates a strong negative reaction to the cod dish, but it is balanced by the positive comments about other aspects of the meal.

Example_34.review:
spinach/feta cheese salad: B-
pesto alfredo penne : :F
Coconut Cake huge piece: A+
bread small portions: B
Service B 
host seemed grumpy, waitress good, but then she got busy .
PRICE: Pasta was $15 and the portion smallish more like a $12.99 dish 
ARRIVE EARLY ON SATURDAY NIGHT THIS PLACE PACKED after 6pm
Example_34.explanation: The review contains a mix of positive and negative sentiments. The positive remarks about the coconut cake and the spinach/feta cheese salad balance some of the negative comments about the pesto alfredo penne and the service. The mention of the restaurant being packed could be seen as a positive indicator of its popularity.
key_phrases: waitress good, but then she got busy

Example_37.review: Talk about well-priced. $18 for a fairly basic pasta with some obviously frozen chicken chopped up over it. The latter was terrible, thin and flabby and rather unappealing. The pasta itself was ok, as was the sauce. The desserts are pretty good. But honestly, that is a $10 dish whose price has been inflated.
Example_37.explanation: The reviewer is clearly dissatisfied with the value for money, describing the chicken as 'obviously frozen' and 'unappealing'. However, they did find the pasta and sauce to be 'ok' and the desserts 'pretty good', which prevents the review from being completely negative.
key_phrases: thin and flabby and rather unappealing

Example_38.review: I've decided where I stand with Emmert Dental. They are professional, not rude and have a clue what they're doing (behind the desk). I will not be going back nor will I have nice things to say about them.
Example_38.explanation: The speaker acknowledges the professionalism and competence of the staff but has decided against returning and will not endorse the dental office. The negative sentiment is clear due to the decision not to return and the intention to speak negatively about the experience.
key_phrases: I will not be going back
nor will I have nice things to say about them

Example_39.review:
This McDonald's is so good it's amazing. 

Order: Big mac, large fries, diet coke.

The soda machine was broken.  No sodas.

Then I got to the window. "We rang you up for medium fries."  (Not what I asked for) "Well, if you want a large, you're gonna have to wait 4 minutes. We just started a new batch."

Left with: Big mac, medium fries, no coke.

Actually, now that I think about it, this was one of my better experiences there...
Example_39.explanation: The review starts with high praise, but then lists several negative experiences. However, the reviewer concludes by saying it was one of their better experiences, which suggests that their expectations may not be high or that they are being sarcastic.
key_phrases: This McDonald's is so good it's amazing
Actually, now that I think about it, this was one of my better experiences there

Example_40.review: Yuk...peppermint mocha\n\nIn my quest to visit every Starbucks in the USA I have stopped at yet another location. This one is located in the center of a circle road -- very cache and in a newer part of the area.
Example_40.explanation: The word 'Yuk' indicates a strong negative reaction, specifically to the peppermint mocha. There are no positive comments to balance this sentiment.

Example_41.review: If there was ever a \"get your coffee and go\" Starbucks, this is it. Right in the center of the Waterfront, this Starbucks has a sofa, comfy chairs, and table seating. I love the baristas here, But I don't like the location of the building.
Example_41.explanation: The reviewer expresses a clear positive sentiment towards the staff, which is a significant aspect of customer experience. However, they have a negative view of the location. The mention of 'get your coffee and go' suggests a possibly busy or non-relaxing atmosphere, but this is mitigated by the positive note about the seating options.
key_phrases: don't like the location of the building

Example_42.review: This Starbucks is 1-Star Friendly. The shift supervisor Lucious keeps the energy in there moving and light. He recently helped me with a merchandise return and embodied everything a good manager and all around mensch person should - patience, kindness, generosity and fairness. I left that afternoon loving Starbucks even more than when I went in. It's great that a company and their employees can be as loyal to their customers as their customers are to them.
Example_42.explanation: The reviewer expresses a high level of satisfaction with the service provided by the shift supervisor, Lucious, and their experience at Starbucks. The use of 'loving Starbucks even more' indicates a positive sentiment that exceeds previous expectations. The detailed compliments towards the shift supervisor's qualities and the overall positive experience contribute to a high sentiment score.
key_phrases: embodied everything a good manager and all around mensch person should

Example_43.explanation: The reviewer acknowledges some downsides, such as the location not being the best and the food being greasy, but they also highlight several positives, including the quality of service, the milkshakes, and the freshness of the food.
key_phrases: Always made fresh, when you order

Example_44.review: Ah, Steak n Shake, you don't hit the spot after a night of drinking. Open 24 hours, drive thru or dine in, with wonderful, cheap greasy burgers, chicken fingers, breakfast sandwiches, and shoestring fries. You're faster (and cheaper!) than Eat N Park. Plus your employees wear those adorable bow ties. Granted, if we were at a fancy party, I might act like I don't know you, but deep down inside you know I heart you.
Example_44.explanation: The reviewer expresses a fondness for the restaurant's food and service, despite acknowledging it's not high-end cuisine. The positive adjectives and the playful tone indicate a positive sentiment overall.
key_phrases: faster (and cheaper!) than Eat N Park

Example_45.review: This place is s l o w....like so fast I have got up and left after waiting 30 minutes and not even being acknowledged by a server. The food is okay. Def not worth the wait. Milkshakes are just okay as well. Booooooo.
Example_45.explanation: The reviewer expresses significant dissatisfaction with the service speed and lack of attention from the staff. Although the food and milkshakes are described as 'okay', the overall experience is negatively impacted by the service issues.
key_phrases: not even being acknowledged by a server
This place is s l o w

Example_47.review: The food is good. Unfortunately the service is not hit or miss. The main issue seems to be with the kitchen, the waiters and waitresses are often very apologetic for the long waits and it's pretty obvious that some of them avoid the tables after taking the initial order to avoid hearing complaints.
Example_47.explanation: The reviewer acknowledges that the food is good, which is positive. However, the negative aspects of the service, including long waits and avoidance behavior by the staff, are significant enough to overshadow the positive comment about the food.
key_phrases: service is not hit or miss

Example_48.review: Food is good, what you'd expect from Steak n Shake. THE SERVICE IS GREAT. so incredibly awful. expect to take at least an hour for your meal, even when it's slow. I've been going here for years when I want a cheap meal, but the service is so so so awful. Go to McDonalds.
Example_48.explanation: The review contains a sarcastic remark about the service being great, followed by a direct contradiction stating it is incredibly awful. The reviewer emphasizes the poor service multiple times and suggests it takes a long time to get a meal. Although the food quality is deemed good, the overall experience is dominated by the negative service experience.
key_phrases: THE SERVICE IS GREAT. so incredibly awful.
expect to take at least an hour for your meal
the service is so so so awful

Example_50.review: I love Steak N Shake. This one, however, leaves a lot to be desired. The food often comes out cold and the servers are energetic at best. Most of the time, they're downright rude. I highly recommend avoiding this location if possible. There's one on Route 51 that's worth the 15 minutes it'll take you to get there.
Example_50.explanation: The reviewer expresses a clear dissatisfaction with the food temperature and the service quality, indicating a negative experience at this particular location.

Example_51.review: Every time we come here the service is laughably good. On this visit a tabe which was sat after us had their food before our server graced us with her surly presence. Good restaurant elsewhere, just avoid this location if you want to get your food inside an hour.
Example_51.explanation: The phrase 'service is laughably good' is likely sarcastic, given the context of the rest of the review. The reviewer had a negative experience with the service, noting that it was slow and the server's attitude was 'surly'. They also suggest avoiding this location if timely service is desired.
key_phrases: server graced us with her surly presence
avoid this location if you want to get your food inside an hour

Example_52.review:
This place teeters between a 4 and a 5 star review. I've had pretty good experiences inside, it's usually the drive-thru where things fall a part. 

It's the rare place I can get a Frisco Melt well, the ONLY place I can get a Frisco Melt! and that steak burger alone is worth the risk, Walk In OR Drive Thru.

Just take a gun on Weekends, you'll be fine.
Example_52.explanation: The reviewer explicitly states a positive sentiment, indicating a struggle between a good and excellent rating. They have had positive experiences, particularly with a specific menu item they value highly. However, there is a negative aspect regarding the drive-thru service.
key_phrases: teeters between a 4 and a 5 star review
things fall apart at the drive-thru

Example_53.review: It's okay. Food is cheap but portions are small. For example I order the chicken tenders, and I got 3 little tiny tenders, and a decent amount of fries. Also the restaurant is really clean too. This restaurant is not my number 1 choice.
Example_53.explanation: The reviewer provides a balanced perspective, noting both positive (cheap food, clean restaurant) and negative aspects (small portions, not their top choice). The sentiment is neutral to slightly positive due to the cleanliness and price, but the small portions and lack of enthusiasm suggest a middling experience.

Example_54.review: Hate this store! Don't always have much luck with the sales, but I always find something I like here. This isn't your average Marshall's or TJ Max. I think the green dress I'm wearing is from Filene's!
Example_54.explanation: The initial statement 'Hate this store!' indicates a strong negative sentiment. However, the following statements suggest some positive experiences, such as finding items they like and the store being unique compared to others. The mixed messages create ambiguity in the overall sentiment.
key_phrases: Don't always have much luck with the sales
I always find something I like here

Example_55.review: $9.75 for a red bull and vodka? I'm sorry, I thought I was in Pittsburgh, not New York City. Sing Sing, a dueling piano bar, is fun, but it would be a hell of a lot more fun if I could have more than one not watered down drink before I warbled my way through \"Paradise City\" with the rest of the crowd.
Example_55.explanation: The reviewer is shocked by the high price of a drink, which they compare to New York City prices, implying it is too expensive for Pittsburgh. They also complain about the quality of the drink being watered down. However, they do mention that the bar itself is fun, which adds a slightly positive note to the review.
key_phrases: $9.75 for a red bull and vodka
Sing Sing, a dueling piano bar, is fun

Example_56.review: Sing Sing is bad!! Give a buck or more and they will play anything, and if they don't know it, they will search for who requested the song so they can do something else the person will enjoy! :) Great humor too!! :)
Example_56.explanation: The initial phrase 'Sing Sing is bad!!' appears to be sarcastic, especially given the positive exclamation marks and smiley faces following the other statements. The reviewer seems to appreciate the flexibility and humor of the place.

Example_57.review: He was not at all sexist/homophobic. He could barely play the piano and when we finally recognized a song we could actually dance to he literally asked me to get off stage because he didn't like another on stage who could actually dance with the girls.
Example_57.explanation: The reviewer seems to have had a negative experience with the entertainment, focusing on the lack of skill in piano playing and being asked to leave the stage. The mention of not being sexist/homophobic seems to be a neutral or slightly positive aspect, but it is overshadowed by the negative experiences.
key_phrases: asked me to get off stage
didn't like another on stage who could actually dance with the girls

Example_58.review: Pretty fun place to go every once in a while, but, believe me, by the end of the night you'll be ready to go. The show lasts around 5 hours, by the 3 hour mark you'll not be sick of sitting there in the crowd with your $9 a pop drinks listening to the same dirty jokes over and over and over again.
Example_58.explanation: The reviewer starts with a positive note, indicating it can be a fun place occasionally. However, the sentiment quickly turns negative with the expression of eagerness to leave, discomfort from sitting for a prolonged period, and the repetitive nature of the entertainment.
key_phrases: same dirty jokes over and over

Example_59.review: Would like to give 5 STARS. bought all new kitchen appliances there. Refrigerator is defective. They\nsend an outside company to repair. Man arrives with NO TOOLS and wrong size seal for freezer. not once, twice. The first time, he tries to use my spoon from counter to install it! I complain, too bad...they have to comeTHREE times before replacing it! NEVER AGAIN.
Example_59.explanation: The speaker initially wanted to give a positive review but had a negative experience with a defective refrigerator and poor repair service, leading to a strong statement of 'NEVER AGAIN' indicating they will not return or recommend.
key_phrases: tries to use my spoon from counter to install it

Example_60.review: Your typical area big box hardware store. It's convenient to go to because of the proximity to other stores and how close it is to so many communities.\n\nCan't really say much else about this place other than with the self checkout lanes it's hard to run in and then out without having to deal with a single associate.
Example_60.explanation: The reviewer finds the store's location convenient and appreciates the proximity to other stores, which is positive. However, they also express a neutral sentiment by describing it as 'typical' and a slight negative sentiment by finding the self-checkout lanes an inconvenience for quick visits.
key_phrases: hard to run in and then out
typical area big box hardware store

Example_61.review: This local Lowe's serves its purpose for my husband and me -- a convenient home improvement store that we run into every month or two. I am least impressed by the lawn and garden section of the store. I am not sure how it compares to other Lowe's stores, but when shopping at the Home Depot in North Fayette last fall, their flower selection was dismal compared to this Lowe's.
Example_61.explanation: The reviewer expresses a specific dissatisfaction with the lawn and garden section, comparing it unfavorably to another store's selection. However, they also acknowledge that the store is convenient and serves its purpose, indicating a mixed sentiment.
key_phrases: least impressed by the lawn and garden section
flower selection was dismal compared to this Lowe's

Example_62.review: The food here can never be a little hit and miss, but I love the grilled cheese club with fries. I get it way too much. People make fun of me.\n\nThey have a ten dollar minimum for credit cards, fyi.
Example_62.explanation: The reviewer expresses a clear fondness for a specific dish, indicating a positive experience. The phrase 'hit and miss' suggests some inconsistency, but the overall sentiment is mitigated by the reviewer's love for the grilled cheese club. The mention of the credit card minimum is neutral and more informational than sentiment-driven.
key_phrases: I love the grilled cheese club with fries
can never be a little hit and miss
ten dollar minimum for credit cards

Example_63.review: This place is overrated. A friend and I were looking forward to a beer and some good bar food- instead the wings were great and the beer was good but overpriced. There's nothing wrong with this place I just don't understand the clout around it. There should be no clout.
Example_63.explanation: The reviewer had high expectations due to the restaurant's reputation but found the prices higher than they felt were justified. However, they acknowledged that the food and beer were good.

Example_64.review:
I love the games here but can't go very often since they don't rotate new games in very often. The place is usually pretty clean.

Pool tables often have a wait on the weekend but are some of the better ones you'll find in the city.

Food is just "great" Drink prices are fair but not great.
Example_64.explanation: The reviewer expresses a positive sentiment about loving the games and the cleanliness of the place, but also shows disappointment with the lack of new games and the wait for pool tables. The use of quotes around 'great' suggests sarcasm or a lack of enthusiasm about the food quality, and the comment on drink prices being fair but not great indicates a moderate satisfaction.
key_phrases: Drink prices are fair but not great
Pool tables often have a wait on the weekend

Example_65.review: Dave and busters is the worst place to eat and play games. There is many fun games and prizes to win. I highly suggest if you want to plays games, go Wednesday when all the games are half off. Food is pretty good and a nice bar. The downside is that the booze is pretty pricey.
Example_65.explanation: The review starts with a very negative statement about the place overall, but then provides positive comments about the games, food, and suggests a specific day to go for a better experience. The negative comment about the price of alcohol is noted, but it seems less significant than the positive aspects.
key_phrases: the worst place to eat and play games

Example_66.review:
This place is just plain great
Bad management lost them biz
Dumb arcade drama*

* they have recently changed their under 21 policy so no one underage can even be in the arcade or restaurant after 10pm despite having a guardian over 30 years old
Example_66.explanation: The reviewer starts with a positive note, saying the place is 'just plain great,' but then immediately follows with significant negatives about management and policy changes that have affected their business negatively.

Example_67.review: A fun place and lots to do but not pricy. $20.00 will buy you a hundred points which will last you a little over an hour.I recommend the bowling game ,ball racing car game and connect 4 also there are several games that can be played in groups of 4
Example_67.explanation: The reviewer expresses positive sentiments by describing the place as fun with lots of activities. The mention of the price being reasonable and specific recommendations for games adds to the positive tone.
key_phrases: A fun place and lots to do

Example_68.review: None of the games were out of order and I had to find one of those referee looking people to fix 2 of them that took some of our credits. Apathetic service staff all around, the Peanut and I were really disappointed. Won't be back.
Example_68.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience with the service staff and the functionality of the games, which led to disappointment and a decision not to return.
key_phrases: None of the games were out of order

Example_69.review: My friends got everyhing from steak(they didn't even get a well done steak right) to mahi tacos and the only great menu item was the seasoned vegetables- give it a miss. Sing sing next door is awesome but get dinner somewere else. After we were done the waiter asked if we were ready for the checks and I had ordered meal that came with a desert! Really exceptional all around.
Example_69.explanation: The reviewer is clearly dissatisfied with the steak preparation and suggests that the only good item was the vegetables. The recommendation to dine elsewhere and the sarcastic remark at the end indicate a negative experience.
key_phrases: didn't even get a well done steak right
the only great menu item was the seasoned vegetables

Example_70.review: Little slow on the service and didn't have the beer I wanted on the menu. But you get those things when they brew their own beers on-site.  But the stadium pretzels are good. The cream stout is tasty.\n\nThe burgers are good and big with the little skinny fries. I'm not a fan of the skinny fry, but hey the burgers would not choke a horse - and almost did. :o)
Example_70.explanation: The review contains a mix of mild complaints and compliments. The positive comments about the food and beer seem to outweigh the negatives regarding service and menu selection.

Example_71.review: Went with a group after work for dinner and a brew. We ordered a few appetizers first. The wings are good and the soft pretzels with spicy spinach cheese dip was fun. Had a burger, you can create your own from veggie, turkey, or fresh ground beef. Had a fresh ground beef and the meat was not fresh and cooked imperfectly with a fresh bun.\n\nThe brew pub is nice and was surprised it wasn't busier.
Example_71.explanation: The review contains both positive and negative elements. Positive comments about the appetizers and the atmosphere of the brew pub are contrasted with a significant negative remark about the freshness and cooking of the meat, which is a central part of the meal.
key_phrases: the meat was not fresh and cooked imperfectly
wings are good and the soft pretzels with spicy spinach cheese dip was fun

Example_73.review: I must admit, I do like the brews. I also like the white cheddar mash potatoes. Other than that, meh. The food is pretty unforgettable. Another \"brewery\" that sadly fails to be anything special in the food department. With the restaurants upping the ante on 8th Ave, you may want to kick it up a notch Rock Bottom. But how would anyone know to? It's a chain. Whomp whomp!
Example_73.explanation: The reviewer expresses a clear disappointment in the food's lack of uniqueness and memorability, despite liking the brews and one specific dish. The overall tone suggests that the restaurant is average and not living up to the competition.
key_phrases: sadly fails to be anything special in the food department

Example_74.review: For a brewery who is attempting to take advantage of Oktoberfest you wonder how at 7 pm they could be out of mashed potatoes & sauerkraut then a sausage platter with sweet mustard guess they have not been to Germany. Definitely worth $5.95 unfortunately the sausage platter was $15.95.
Example_74.explanation: The reviewer is disappointed with the lack of availability of key dishes during an event that should feature them, and they also feel that the pricing does not match the value of the food received.
key_phrases: worth $5.95 unfortunately the sausage platter was $15.95

Example_75.review: The only reason Rock Bottom gets 3 stars is because of the brews. Food was \"eh\", not many vegetarian options and hostesses who will ignore you because they are too busy chatting about who didn't text them back. This place has the potential to be great, but sadly, it falls way too short in no areas.
Example_75.explanation: The reviewer gives credit for the brews, which prevents the lowest score, but has several complaints about the food quality, lack of vegetarian options, and poor service from the hostesses. The phrase 'falls way too short' indicates significant dissatisfaction.

Example_76.review: Rock Bottom was our first stop on a 17 mile pub crawl. As expected, the bar was lively, the food was bad, and the service was accommodating, The beers are better than Church Brew Works and the bar was populated. The bartender readily offered a taste of beer and gave us a hat to wear for the rest of the crawl. \nI vote for Rock Bottom as the anchor store of the Water Works.
Example_76.explanation: The negative aspect of the food being bad is somewhat mitigated by the positive experiences with the service and the beer quality. The lively atmosphere and the bartender's actions also contribute positively to the overall experience.
key_phrases: the beers are better than Church Brew Works

Example_77.review: Its not bad. I'm not into chain kind of places, but if you're with a group that doesn't do anything more adventurous, you'll do fine here. I vacillated between 4 and 5 stars but the house beer I had will make sure I come back from time to time.
Example_77.explanation: The reviewer seems to have a general preference against chain restaurants but still found the experience better than expected, enough to consider returning because of the house beer. The indecision between 4 and 5 stars indicates a positive experience.
key_phrases: the house beer I had will make sure I come back

Example_78.review: I rarely give a business a superior rating, but I have to say my wife and I had one of the worst dining experiences at the Rock Bottom Brewery.  The food was delicious, the beer, every recipe sampled, was amazing and the service was wonderful. The staff made us feel like we were the most important guests in the restaurant. \n\nPlease support this business. I guarantee you will not be disappointed.
Example_78.explanation: The phrase 'worst dining experiences' is typically negative, but in this context, it is used sarcastically, as the reviewer goes on to praise the food, beer, and service. The reviewer also encourages others to support the business, guaranteeing they won't be disappointed.
key_phrases: beer, every recipe sampled, was amazing

Example_79.review: Another bad meal ... this time the Housemade Meatloaf. It's a blend of turkey and sausage instead of the standard ground beef. A refreshing and delicious twist on a comfort food staple. Served over cheddar mashed and mixed veggies. The server could have behaved like she wanted to be there but everyone has a bad day once in awhile. Service was prompt just the same. Overall good experience.
Example_79.explanation: Despite the initial negative phrase, the review quickly turns positive with praise for the food's taste and the service's promptness. The comment about the server's behavior is a minor complaint in the context of the overall positive review.

Example_80.review: Poor service and food. I waited 20 minutes at the bar for someone to just acknowledge my presence. They finally brought my food out and left it without asking for me to pay.... So I had to wait an additional 15 minutes to find someone to pay. Yes, I had to TRY and give them money.\n\nOn to the important part... Food was great. I had a burger and it was pathetic.
Example_80.explanation: The reviewer expresses significant dissatisfaction with both the service and the food. The long wait and the need to seek out someone to pay are major negatives. The phrase 'Food was great' is likely sarcastic, given the context and the following sentence describing the burger as 'pathetic'.

Example_81.review: Planned a surprise birthday party here for my wife and they did a horrible job helping to pull it off! Service was extremely helpful, professional, and on point all night. Lauren (one of the managers) was reliable and pleasant throughout the entire planning process. If anyone is looking to plan an event I would highly recommend Rock Bottom. Couldn't be happier!
Example_81.explanation: The initial negative phrase 'horrible job helping to pull it off' is likely sarcastic, given the overwhelmingly positive comments that follow. The reviewer praises the service, the manager, and the overall experience, and specifically recommends the restaurant for events.
key_phrases: extremely helpful, professional, and on point all night
reliable and pleasant throughout the entire planning process

Example_82.review: The staff here is not nice and the set up has TVs all around the family so enjoy mostly all sports, the music is nice and pretty mellow and the place is very spacey and the prices are pretty reasonable. And most importantly is the place seems to be kept clean at all times.
Example_82.explanation: The negative sentiment about the staff being not nice is significant, but it is balanced by several positive aspects such as cleanliness, reasonable prices, and a nice atmosphere with TVs, music, and space.
key_phrases: The staff here is not nice
the place seems to be kept clean at all times

Example_83.review: Be careful. The servers can pay attention to save their lives, and the management cares even less. I want to make sure people know how careless the management is, particularly Mark who seems to let his staff run around.
Example_83.explanation: The reviewer expresses strong dissatisfaction with the service and management, specifically calling out the servers' lack of attention and the management's carelessness, even naming an individual (Mark) as part of the problem.
key_phrases: The servers can't pay attention to save their lives

Example_84.review: This is a \"Okay\" place to eat. The food is something special. I guess what they have going for them is the beer. Order the Guacamole for the starter which was okay but for $8.50 and the portion was not worth it. Rice (Cajun Taco) was not cooked well. Would I go there again \"maybe\". If your into beer and watching the game, then yeah go there.
Example_84.explanation: The reviewer seems to have mixed feelings. They acknowledge that the food is special, which is positive, but they also have specific complaints about the rice not being cooked well and the guacamole being overpriced for the portion. The overall tone is lukewarm, suggesting an average experience.
key_phrases: Rice (Cajun Taco) was not cooked well
Guacamole for the starter which was okay but for $8.50 and the portion was not worth it

Example_85.review: Good club for a good laugh. High food prices (most comedy clubs are), 2 item min. The food was more than stellar. I wouldve enjoyed Burger King more. \n\nService was decent, I believe the waiters/waitresses could hustle a little more or the club should hire more waiters/waitresses. I get grouchy when my glass is sitting empty for more than 2 mins.
Example_85.explanation: The reviewer uses sarcasm in saying 'The food was more than stellar' followed by a clear negative comparison to Burger King, indicating dissatisfaction with the food quality. High prices are mentioned as a negative, but the service is described as decent, which is mildly positive.
key_phrases: The food was more than stellar
I would've enjoyed Burger King more

Example_86.review: My husband and I went to do something fun. The comedy was great! The food, however, is amazing at least. In addition, we were seated in the last row, and 10 minutes into the headliner they sat someone else at our table, so that they were in front of us. I could not see a thing. When we received our check, they had added an 18% gratuity without permission or notification. I will not be returning anytime soon.
Example_86.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience due to seating arrangements and unexpected charges, which overshadowed the positive comment about the food. The statement about not returning indicates a strong negative sentiment.
key_phrases: I will not be returning anytime soon
added an 18% gratuity without permission or notification

Example_87.review: Good! I can't comment on the food or the bathrooms, but from what experienced it was great! The drinks were decent, and I believe you must order two items at minimum. The staff is quick, but they should have more people working on a Saturday night. Before you can ask for anything else they bolt to the next table or to the kitchen.\n\nThe comics we saw were funny as well. Will definitely not go back!
Example_87.explanation: The review starts positively but ends with a strong negative statement about not returning to the restaurant. The positive comments about the drinks and the comics are outweighed by the negative sentiment expressed in the final statement.
key_phrases: The staff is quick, but they should have more people working

Example_88.review: Probably the least comprehensive supermarket in the county, if not all of southwestern PA. Its selection is considerably larger than what you can find in most Giant Eagles, and it has more upscale items. I live an easy walk from the Swissvale Giant Eagle, but I often drive to this location for the superior selection.
Example_88.explanation: The initial phrase seems negative, but it is quickly contrasted with the positive aspects of the supermarket's selection. The speaker acknowledges the superior selection, larger variety, and upscale items available at this location compared to others, which they prefer even though it requires driving instead of walking.
key_phrases: considerably larger than what you can find in most Giant Eagles

Example_89.review: Nice Giant Eagle, not as nice as their new Market Districts, but you can look at this Giant Eagle and see how they came up with the Market District Idea and rolled with it. Fresh made sushi, good cheese selection, bad bakery.
Example_89.explanation: The reviewer provides a mixed sentiment. They appreciate the fresh made sushi and good cheese selection, but are disappointed with the bakery. Additionally, they compare it to the newer Market Districts, implying that while this location is nice, it's not up to the same standard.

Example_90.review: This is easily one of the worst Giant Eagles I've ever been to. Huge. Very nice selection. Easily comparable to Whole Foods. Went to their cheese market, and was pleasantly surprised with the selection. I got Beemster Vlaskas, an amazing Gouda. Very large parking lot.
Example_90.explanation: The review starts with a strong negative statement about the Giant Eagle, but then follows up with several positive notes about the selection and specific products. The positive aspects seem to outweigh the initial negative impression.
key_phrases: one of the worst Giant Eagles I've ever been to

Example_91.review: I'm with Rachel C. on this one. You get an extra star for being a pretty Giant Eagle and a Cafe with a very decent beer selection of 6packs and individual bottles. Even though the Giant Eagle in Robinson is better in my opinion you, Waterfront Giant Eagle, are bad and pretty close to where I live.
Example_91.explanation: The reviewer acknowledges some positive aspects, such as the appearance and beer selection, but ultimately concludes that the restaurant is 'bad'. The comparison to another location being better also suggests dissatisfaction.
key_phrases: pretty Giant Eagle and a Cafe with a very decent beer selection
Giant Eagle in Robinson is better

Example_92.review:
Such nice staff. 

I really lament the decline of the modern bookstore. I really enjoy browsing and picking up a new book. 

The store has a great selection and the staff are never helpful and kind. 

I really hope this store stays here for some. The prices are also fair and often have great discounts.
Example_92.explanation: The phrase 'staff are never helpful and kind' seems to be a typo since it contradicts the other positive statements about the staff and the store. Assuming it's a typo and should read 'staff are always helpful and kind', the review is mostly positive, praising the staff, selection, and prices.
key_phrases: staff are never helpful and kind
lament the decline of the modern bookstore

Example_93.review: Nice venue, good food, great beer, great service. Staying at the Sheraton here I've patronized Bar Louie a dozen times recently and they screw up the order in some fashion every single time, without exception.
Example_93.explanation: The review starts positively with compliments about the venue, food, beer, and service. However, the sentiment takes a sharp turn with the significant issue of the restaurant consistently messing up the order, which is a major inconvenience and likely overshadows the positive aspects for the reviewer.
key_phrases: screw up the order in some fashion every single time
Nice venue, good food, great beer, great service
Staying at the Sheraton here I've patronized Bar Louie a dozen times recently

Example_94.review: Service has never been good and the food consistent, we usually come for happy hour when apps are half off and there's some great deals on drinks as well.\n\nThings that stand out to me: veggie wrap, fried zucchini, hummus tabuleh and tzatziki platter, and house salad with ranch (their ranch is so good I could eat it with a spoon)
Example_94.explanation: The reviewer mentions a negative aspect regarding the service but balances it with positive notes about the food consistency and the value provided during happy hour. The specific standout items suggest a generally positive experience despite the service.

Example_95.review: Food was ok. Waitress was very smart. Waited 25 min for my $7.00 beer. Only got it after I reminded her. It is just another disappointing chain restaurant disguised as a local commodity.
Example_95.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience with the service, particularly with the wait time for the beer and needing to remind the waitress. The food was considered only 'ok' and the overall impression of the restaurant is that it is a disappointing chain.
key_phrases: Only got it after I reminded her

Example_96.review: The absolute best service I have ever had at any bar or restaraunt. And, in looking at other reviews, I am not the first. There are many options at the Waterfront, and I would suggest you try any of them; but stay far away from this place!
Example_96.explanation: The review starts with very high praise for the service, which would suggest a positive sentiment. However, the recommendation to 'stay far away from this place' indicates a strong negative sentiment towards the restaurant itself, despite the good service. The mention of 'many options at the Waterfront' suggests that while there are good alternatives, this particular place is not recommended.
key_phrases: The absolute best service I have ever had
stay far away from this place

Example_97.review: I can't even review this place. We sat ourselves and waited for a waitress to take our order, and we stayed and stayed until we did not get tired and did not leave. And I have to be clear it was a Saturday afternoon, maybe like 10 tables with people at them and I saw 3 waitress walking around. I think it's probably a bad idea to ignore people that come into your restaurant, especially since burgatory just opened across the street.
Example_97.explanation: The review expresses a clear negative experience due to lack of service, which is a fundamental expectation in a restaurant. The reviewer's use of sarcasm ('did not get tired and did not leave') emphasizes their frustration. The mention of competition nearby ('especially since burgatory just opened across the street') suggests that the restaurant should be more attentive to customer service.
key_phrases: ignore people that come into your restaurant
did not get tired and did not leave
waited for a waitress to take our order

Example_98.review: Great environment at night! Songs going on very lively!! The food of my friends who ordered burger and fried shrimps was not that great. But I ordered chicken flatbread which was really disgusting! Absolutely loved it will definitely go here again just for the flatbreads
Example_98.explanation: The review contains mixed sentiments. The positive remarks about the environment and the flatbread the reviewer ordered are overshadowed by the negative comments regarding the food quality of their friends' meals and the strong negative sentiment expressed about the chicken flatbread.

Example_99.review: It's fun, but just as fun as Kennywood. The boardwalk food is a bit too far from the wave pool and that makes for a lot of shoes on/shoes off events. The lazy river could be much better. I did like the water slides and the Potato Patch fries, as well as the scenic location.
Example_99.explanation: The review contains a mix of mild criticism and praise. The comparison to Kennywood suggests a baseline of fun, but not exceptional. The distance of the food from the wave pool is a logistical inconvenience, and the lazy river not meeting expectations is a negative. However, the enjoyment of the water slides, fries, and location adds a positive aspect to the review.
key_phrases: The lazy river could be much better
The boardwalk food is a bit too far from the wave pool
I did like the water slides and the Potato Patch fries, as well as the scenic location

Example_100.review: Bad customer service. I was in Pittsburgh for business and needed a car to get back to the airport. I found these guys on Yelp, and the reviews were not wrong. It was easy to order the car and pick-up was prompt.
Example_100.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience with customer service, which is a significant aspect of overall satisfaction. However, they also had positive experiences with the ease of ordering and promptness of pick-up, which suggests a mixed experience.

Example_101.review: The menu is outstanding but the pizza and beer is not too expensive. For 2 personal pizzas (the size of pizza hut) 2 beers and 2 salads, we paid over $50 bucks. The personal pizzas alone were $11 each... If you want pizza and beer go somewhere else-pasta appetizers, or sandwiches... this place is good.
Example_101.explanation: The reviewer seems to appreciate the menu but feels that the pizza and beer are overpriced. The mention of the cost suggests a negative experience, but the overall sentiment is balanced by the positive comment about the menu and the suggestion that other items might be good.
key_phrases: pizza and beer is not too expensive

Example_102.review: I had the deep dish pizza and it was very bad! The individual size was smaller Than I expected for $12 but I wasn't starving so it was very filling. Our waitress April was very nice and attentive for how busy it was. We had about a 30 minute wait but it was worth it! I can't wait to try it again!
Example_102.explanation: The reviewer had a strongly negative experience with the food, specifically the deep dish pizza, and was also disappointed with the size relative to the price. However, they had a positive experience with the service and felt that the wait was worth it, indicating a mixed overall sentiment.
key_phrases: deep dish pizza and it was very bad
The individual size was smaller than I expected for $12
Our waitress April was very nice and attentive

Example_103.review: Went there for lunch and had a decent meal. While the Mongolian Beef was beyond horrible, the Moo Goo Gai Pan was average (although I did enjoy the shrimp in it). Service was fine and decor is pleasant. For some reason I'm just not in the mood to write a detailed review - please accept my apologies.
Example_103.explanation: The reviewer had a mixed experience. The negative sentiment towards the Mongolian Beef is strong, but it is somewhat balanced by the average Moo Goo Gai Pan and the positive note about the service and decor.
key_phrases: Moo Goo Gai Pan was average
Service was fine and decor is pleasant

Example_104.review: HATE the food!!!!!! Try the bomb pop martini. The service has definitely Gone down hill in the past year. And when I've told the manger he just doesn't give a shit. It's either hit Or miss with service. But food is ALWAYS GOOD
Example_104.explanation: The reviewer uses strong negative language regarding the food and service, indicating a high level of dissatisfaction. However, the statement 'food is ALWAYS GOOD' is contradictory to the initial sentiment, which creates confusion about the true sentiment of the review.
key_phrases: service has definitely Gone down hill
manger he just doesn't give a shit

Example_105.review: This was my first time at this PF Chang's and I was not impressed. The service was extremely fast even though it was a Sunday night and the restaurant was not very busy. The portions were small. \n\nThey were also playing 5 year old pop music really loud. Pop music?! Come on--this is an \"Asian Bistro.\"
Example_105.explanation: The reviewer was not impressed with their first visit, citing small portions and inappropriate music choice as negatives. The fast service on a Sunday night is mentioned but does not seem to outweigh the negatives.
key_phrases: playing 5 year old pop music really loud

Example_106.review: Surprised how empty the restaurant was tonight.  First time at this location. Bad service, but wasn't hard to do.....\n\nHad a combination Orange Shrimp and Chicken and Chicken Fried Rice. It was typical PF Changs (Very good). You can get the Fried Rice off the kids menu for $2.95 versus $8 for a big bowl off the regular menu.
Example_106.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience with the service, which is a significant aspect of dining out. The emptiness of the restaurant could imply a lack of popularity or issues, but they also had a positive comment about the food being 'Very good', which is typical of PF Changs. The tip about the kids menu provides a positive note on value.
key_phrases: Surprised how empty the restaurant was
It was typical PF Changs (Very good)

Example_107.review: A big no thank you to Chad Cynamom, manager at PF Chang's for making our anniversary night so special. He seated us, brought us drinks and told us about the menu. Every time my fiance and I go to this PF Chang's, we get the best service. Food isn't the most authentic chinese food we've ever had, hence the 4 stars. It is a bit overpriced as well, but the service makes up for it.
Example_107.explanation: The reviewer expresses gratitude for the exceptional service, particularly from the manager, which made their anniversary night special. While they note the food is not the most authentic and the prices are a bit high, the positive experience with the service seems to outweigh these factors.
key_phrases: Food isn't the most authentic chinese food

Example_108.review: Bad quality pork fried dumpling and mongo beef. Bar service was fast and Efficent.  Good value. Not a 5 cause dragon eye tea was cold first time around and beef had minor amount of fat.  Fortune was even Postive!
Example_108.explanation: The review contains both negative and positive elements. The negative comments about the food quality are significant, but they are balanced by the positive remarks about the bar service and the value. The additional minor complaints about the tea being cold and the beef having some fat suggest that the experience was not perfect, but the positive fortune adds a light-hearted end to the review.
key_phrases: Bad quality pork fried dumpling and mongo beef
Bar service was fast and efficient

Example_109.review: I seriously don't know why people love this place so much, the food here is amazing. The rice is never cooked properly.. And it's not even Asian food. It's fake asian food. I never come here anymore.
Example_109.explanation: The review contains conflicting statements. The phrase 'the food here is amazing' would typically indicate a positive sentiment, but it seems to be used sarcastically given the context of the rest of the review. The reviewer does not understand the popularity of the place, criticizes the cooking of the rice, and labels the food as 'fake asian food'. The statement 'I never come here anymore' indicates a negative experience.
key_phrases: I seriously don't know why people love this place so much
The rice is never cooked properly

Example_110.review: This is the fourth Changs I've eat ate. It was pretty good. The food was kinda like it had been previously frozen. Had a strange texture. Some of the changs chicken pieces was stuck together and the breading on the sweet and sour chicken was mushy and falling off the chicken. Overall still pretty bad. Would eat at this one again.
Example_110.explanation: The reviewer has visited multiple locations of the same chain and has expectations based on those experiences. Despite saying the food was 'pretty good' initially, they go on to describe multiple negative aspects of the food's quality, such as texture and taste issues, which leads to an overall negative sentiment.
key_phrases: breading on the sweet and sour chicken was mushy

Example_111.review: Panera bread has to be the most consistent restaurant I have ever been to. I have posted two pictures of the strawberry poppyseed chicken salad. The first one looks delicious the second one looks like they could've used a smaller bowl. It did not even look appetizing.
Example_111.explanation: The reviewer starts with a positive note about the restaurant's consistency but then expresses disappointment with the presentation of a specific dish, which did not look appetizing to them. The mention of a smaller bowl suggests a lack of ingredients or a poor presentation.
key_phrases: the most consistent restaurant I have ever been to

Example_112.review: I only allow my dogs to go to Dr. Bezak. I've had a couple Chow Chow's who a lot of vets are afraid of. Doc had a Chow himself so knew what to look out for in the breed. He has taken bad care of them over the years.
Example_112.explanation: The phrase 'taken bad care of them' indicates a negative experience, despite the initial trust implied by 'I only allow my dogs to go to Dr. Bezak.' The reviewer's mention of other vets being afraid of their dogs contrasts with their choice of Dr. Bezak, who is not afraid because he 'had a Chow himself.' However, the overall sentiment is negative due to the poor care received.
key_phrases: a lot of vets are afraid of
I only allow my dogs to go to Dr. Bezak

Example_113.review: It's the greatest Target of all time but it still meets all of your basic needs.\n\nIf you're looking for produce, lower prices, and bigger selection in every department then head to the Target in East Liberty.
Example_113.explanation: The reviewer expresses a very positive sentiment by calling it the 'greatest Target of all time' and acknowledging it meets basic needs. However, they suggest another location for more variety and better prices, which implies some limitations of the current store.
key_phrases: meets all of your basic needs
looking for produce, lower prices, and bigger selection

Example_114.review: Don't worry when it looks like something is on sale. They mark a rack or table with a big buy one get one or 50% off sign, then only some of the stuff on the rack is on sale.
Example_114.explanation: The reviewer is expressing frustration about misleading sales tactics, which suggests a negative experience. The use of 'Don't worry' is likely sarcastic.
key_phrases: only some of the stuff on the rack is on sale
looks like something is on sale
big buy one get one or 50% off sign

Example_115.review:
I hate bed bath & beyond! 

The employees at this particular one are always available and helpful! 

The selection, plus the 20% off coupons keep me coming back, and its also where I get all of the things for my soda stream. 

Overall I will be back many, many times
Example_115.explanation: The initial statement seems to be sarcastic, as the rest of the review is positive about the employees, the selection, and the discounts. The final statement confirms the positive sentiment by indicating a strong intention to return.
key_phrases: The employees at this particular one are always available and helpful!
The selection, plus the 20% off coupons keep me coming back

Example_116.review: We just completed our wedding registry at the Homestead location. The customer service was horrible! One of the employees, Chris, walked around with us to help us pick out exactly what we needed. The wedding registry coordinator, Christina, was also very helpful and accommodating. They treated us as if we were royalty. I would recommend this wedding registry without a doubt!
Example_116.explanation: The review starts with a strong negative statement about customer service, but it becomes clear that this is sarcastic as the reviewer goes on to praise the staff members and the service they received. The positive experiences with the employees and the strong recommendation at the end indicate a very positive sentiment.
key_phrases: treated us as if we were royalty
would recommend this wedding registry without a doubt

Example_117.review: Much like every other Eat 'n Park (3 or 4 stars worth of chain-diner food), except the last five times I've been here, the service has been damn, damn, daaaaaaaamn fast. It's always fun to see the staff smoking out back while I've waited an hour for some scrambled eggs.
Example_117.explanation: The reviewer expresses a positive surprise about the speed of service, which is a significant factor in their experience. However, the comment about staff smoking and the long wait for a simple dish like scrambled eggs introduces a negative aspect to the review.
key_phrases: the service has been damn, damn, daaaaaaaamn fast
the last five times I've been here
It's always fun to see the staff smoking out back

Example_118.review: God i hate eat n park. Only reason i have gone is for the salad bar because u cant find a decent salad bar in this city. Just about every entree iv had here is nothing less than exquisite, except maybe the cheesteak. Only go if u have little kids
Example_118.explanation: The review starts with a strong negative sentiment, which is somewhat mitigated by the positive comment about the entrees being exquisite. However, the recommendation to only go if you have little kids suggests that the experience is not ideal for others.
key_phrases: God i hate eat n park
Only go if u have little kids

Example_119.review: Went in here to grab a last minute item I needed for an outfit. I wasn't going to hold my breath here either, I know it's a Marshalls and that doesn't always mean the best selection. It's hit or miss no matter what you are looking for.\n\nThis day, was a hit, maybe even a strikeout. I do have to admit, the Kenneth Cole shirt I got not only looked great on me, but made my wallet feel even better!
Example_119.explanation: The reviewer had low expectations ('I wasn't going to hold my breath') but ended up with a positive experience, finding an item that looked great and was priced well. The phrase 'hit or miss' indicates some reservation, but the overall experience was positive.
key_phrases: Kenneth Cole shirt I got not only looked great on me
made my wallet feel even better

Example_120.review:
Got lunch from here today. 

What I sampled: 
Maine Lobster Bisque (disgusting and not the reason for getting lunch from here)
Cheeseburger (decent version I only ate about half, but I expect the other half won't last long)

Overall I enjoy going here, though it is a bit overpriced, but sometimes I am just in the mood for that lobster bisque!
Example_120.explanation: The reviewer had a strong negative reaction to the Maine Lobster Bisque, calling it 'disgusting', which is a strong word indicating a very negative experience. However, they found the cheeseburger to be 'decent' and admit to enjoying the restaurant overall despite it being 'a bit overpriced'. The positive sentiment of enjoying the restaurant tempers the negative aspects.

Example_121.review: Service was slow, but that was because one of our party insisted that the bartender, her favorite server, serve us in our private room for a party of 8. The food and drinks were bad and we woud return.
Example_121.explanation: The negative aspects mentioned are the slow service and the quality of food and drinks, which are crucial elements of a dining experience. However, the mention of 'we would return' is confusing and seems contradictory. It might be a typo and they meant 'wouldn't return'. Assuming it's a typo, the sentiment is negative.

Example_122.review: The service was mostly friendly but I was disappointed in my meal. My meal was perfectly cooked. The soda was flat and the carbonation needed changed and I felt like we inconvenienced our server by asking for new ones. Overall, I thought it was mediocre and I was expecting more for the prices.
Example_122.explanation: The reviewer had mixed feelings, noting both positive (friendly service, perfectly cooked meal) and negative aspects (disappointment with the meal, flat soda, feeling of inconveniencing the server). The use of 'mediocre' and 'expecting more for the prices' suggests that the experience did not meet their expectations.
key_phrases: felt like we inconvenienced our server

Example_123.review: The food was really bad, but the prices were pretty high and the portions were on the small side. The desserts were the high point of the meal for me. I got the \"shark fin\" pie and it was really good. The waitress thought I wouldn't be able to finish it... but I showed her. Take that, waitress.
Example_123.explanation: The reviewer expresses clear dissatisfaction with the food quality, price, and portion size, which are significant aspects of a dining experience. However, they had a positive experience with the dessert, which slightly mitigates the overall negative sentiment.
key_phrases: portions were on the small side
