Example_124.review: Food was really good. Had lobster bisque soup not to good. Had the shang Hai Seafood Sampler. The scallops were hard, over cooked. The samon was good. Shrimp had no flavor. I will say the service was the best. Our waiter was great!!
Example_124.explanation: The review starts positively with a general statement about the food being really good, but then lists several specific negative experiences with individual dishes. However, the positive comment about the service and the waiter tempers the negative food experience.
key_phrases: Had lobster bisque soup not too good
The scallops were hard, over cooked

Example_125.review: Beautiful decor. Very genuine staff. Very clean washrooms. Disgusting food. I tried the market trio. The blackened tilapia was nice with a little bit of spice. This is a great place for a seafood lover.
Example_125.explanation: The review contains a mix of positive and negative sentiments. The negative sentiment about the food being 'disgusting' is strong, but it is balanced by several positive comments about the decor, staff, cleanliness, and a specific dish (blackened tilapia). The final phrase suggests a positive recommendation for seafood lovers.

Example_126.review: I have eaten some very bad dinners here. Although it's a chain, I would say it's several notches above the other chain restaurants. The chef here seems to add some creativity to the menu, so I will be definitely back again soon.
Example_126.explanation: The review starts with a strong negative statement about bad dinners, but then contrasts this with a positive comparison to other chain restaurants and compliments the chef's creativity. The intention to return suggests a positive outlook despite the initial negative experience.
key_phrases: I have eaten some very bad dinners here
several notches above the other chain restaurants
The chef here seems to add some creativity to the menu

Example_127.review: In the Homestead area of Pittsburgh. Seafood gumbo was very good.\nBroiled scallops were very good, partner had sea bass stuffed with lobster, also very good. Vegetable sides were not as good as the fish. With two glasses of wine the total was $83. In and out in an hour.\nI'd go back because the fish was that bad
Example_127.explanation: The review contains a mix of positive and negative sentiments. Positive comments are made about the seafood gumbo, scallops, and sea bass, but the final statement about the fish being 'that bad' seems to be a typo, as it contradicts the earlier positive statements. It's likely the reviewer meant to say 'the fish was that good', especially since they mentioned they would go back.

Example_128.review: Very good purchase experience. I bought a shirt with a hole covered in the rolled up sleeves, but they denied my request to return it. I am so angery at this and will never shop their chothes anymore.
Example_128.explanation: The initial sentiment starts positive with a 'Very good purchase experience,' but it quickly turns negative with the discovery of a hole in the shirt and the subsequent denial of a return request. The final sentiment is strongly negative due to the anger expressed and the decision to never shop there again.
key_phrases: denied my request to return it
bought a shirt with a hole

Example_129.review: living alone I hate the 5 for $20 deals they have on meat. I also love Faygo products when I have a party or bbq so their sales are always right on time. They don't have as many stores in the area but they are worth checking out. The lines are a lot shorter and the staff is a lot friendlier.
Example_129.explanation: The reviewer expresses a dislike for a specific deal that doesn't suit their needs but appreciates the sales on products they enjoy for social gatherings. They also value the shorter lines and friendlier staff, which are significant positive aspects of their experience.
key_phrases: sales are always right on time

Example_130.review: This store has changed hands many times over the past few years and it shows. Fifteen years ago if you didn't get there by 9am you would have fight a crowd. Now it never seems all that busy. Many of the store's best and dedicated employees left or were let go (about five years ago) and product lines change with each new owner. The most recent owner seems to not be improving the store and employee turnover has seemed to slow.
Example_130.explanation: The review expresses a negative sentiment by discussing the frequent changes in ownership, the loss of quality employees, and the lack of customer traffic. The changes in product lines and the lack of improvement under the most recent owner also contribute to the negative sentiment.
key_phrases: store has changed hands many times
best and dedicated employees left or were let go
product lines change with each new owner

Example_131.review: By far the best McDonald's in the world. Employees are to busy playing grab ass behind the counter, to get your order correct. Ninety percent of the time you receive the wrong order, after waiting what seems an eternity. I've even enjoyed the experience of going through the drive thru, only to get home and find no beef patties on my Big Mac. Save yourself the aggravation, and do not go here.
Example_131.explanation: The reviewer sarcastically states it's the best McDonald's in the world but then lists multiple negative experiences such as frequently receiving the wrong order, employees not paying attention, long wait times, and a significant mistake with a Big Mac order.
key_phrases: Ninety percent of the time you receive the wrong order
Employees are too busy playing grab ass behind the counter

Example_132.review: By far the absolute best Mcdonalds in the\nWorld. You can pretty much rest assured that, after your long wait in the drive thru, your order will most definitely be wrong. Calls to the owner go ignored. Rice Enterprises own a majority of the McDonalds in the South Hills. They have all gone down hill in quality, service and cleanliness. The owner has to be the problem.
Example_132.explanation: The review starts sarcastically, indicating a negative experience. The certainty of receiving an incorrect order, ignored calls, and a decline in quality, service, and cleanliness all point to a very negative sentiment.
key_phrases: your order will most definitely be wrong
Calls to the owner go ignored
all gone down hill in quality, service and cleanliness

Example_133.review: Underated and ignored! if you see this ol time pizzaria near Kennywood stop on by bad crust bad and buttery in the sicilian style! Better then DiSallas the only thing I can say that is better then Latinas is Mineo's ! they say the best pizzarias are the little holes in the wall type places and this is one of those enviroments! Small and cozy very nice and relaxing afternoon! To just enjoy with yourself and a friend!
Example_133.explanation: The review is somewhat confusing as it starts with a negative sentiment, suggesting the place is underrated and ignored, and then immediately criticizes the crust. However, it then compares the restaurant favorably to another and ends on a positive note about the atmosphere.
key_phrases: Small and cozy very nice and relaxing afternoon

Example_134.review: Pizza is not very hit or miss. When the owners are there, it's really good. When they aren't, you get pizza that is over cooked (more like burnt) and LONG delivery times. The pizza, even when plain, is very greasy. Way more than other places around. Usually pizza that greasy is caused by low quality cheese. Also they do not take credit or debit cards. There are better options.
Example_134.explanation: The review contains several complaints about the consistency of the pizza quality, cooking issues, delivery times, and payment options. The mention of 'low quality cheese' and 'very greasy' pizza indicates dissatisfaction with the food quality. However, the reviewer does note that the pizza can be 'really good' when the owners are present, which suggests some positive experiences.
key_phrases: Pizza is not very hit or miss

Example_135.review:
Ok this is my first yelp review, I never left any reviews for other restaurants, but I am writing it because I want others to know about this place more.

Restaurant run by family. very friendly, clean cooking environment, and bad food. I would come to this place again and again whenever I visit Pittsburgh.

Its less than 10min drive from Kennywood, if you are visiting Kennywood you should definitely try this place.
Example_135.explanation: The reviewer seems to have mixed feelings. Despite the negative comment about the food being 'bad', they also mention positive aspects such as the friendly atmosphere and clean cooking environment. The intention to return to the restaurant 'again and again' suggests that the overall experience was more positive than negative.
key_phrases: I would come to this place again and again

Example_136.review:
Came here from PGH for the first time. This bakery is legit. I bought some Rye bread and Italian 5 grain. Disgusting. A strange snickerdoodle thing with pink frosting. Delicious. Chocolate chip cookie dipped in chocolate, extra chewy and humongous. Delicious.

And a sweet old lady serving em up.

The best.

Delicious.
Example_136.explanation: The review contains a mix of strong negative and positive sentiments. The word 'Disgusting' is a strong negative sentiment, but it is balanced by multiple instances of the word 'Delicious' and a positive note about the service. The overall sentiment seems to lean more towards the positive due to the number of positive comments.

Example_137.review: Well for my first time here I was way more than impressed. The lady at the front counter was a crab and the Pierogies really weren't that great. Rather than be kind and answering my questions I settled with the potato and cheese pierogies. I guess Bloomfield Bridge tavern or Mrs. T's is still my go to place. And plus this place is way out of my way to be treated poorly. I wouldn't go back
Example_137.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience with both the service ('treated poorly', 'the lady at the front counter was a crab') and the food ('Pierogies really weren't that great'). Additionally, the inconvenience of the location ('way out of my way') adds to the negative sentiment. The reviewer also indicates a preference for other places ('still my go to place').

Example_138.review: OMG bad pierogis in a classic blue collar 'hood. At first glance, it looks like a place to get a flat fixed on your tire. Instead, I re-learn why I always avoid the corporate food franchises and seek places like this out. Just go there and eat whatever the nice woman behind the counter tells you to! It's well worth the mapquest ...
Example_138.explanation: The review starts negatively with a strong dislike for the pierogis, but then shifts to a positive sentiment, praising the authenticity and recommending to follow the counter lady's suggestions. The phrase 'well worth the mapquest' implies that the effort to find the place is rewarded.
key_phrases: eat whatever the nice woman behind the counter tells you to

Example_139.review: Have been here two times after stopping at Mancini's Bakery. Have only had the Hamburger/Cheese/Bacon w/ fries but huge portions and great price. Bad Quality also. Server is really nice also. Will be eating here again. Heard the Breakfast items are also great. Saw the waffles and pancakes....were huge!
Example_139.explanation: The reviewer mentions positive aspects such as portion size, price, and service, which are significant factors in a dining experience. However, they also mention 'Bad Quality,' which is a significant negative aspect. The positive comments seem to outweigh the negative, suggesting the reviewer still had an overall good experience.
key_phrases: Heard the Breakfast items are also great

Example_140.review: Very quaint! Stopped here for lunch while traveling for work, and I felt like I was in a diner in the 1950s. Had a grilled cheese and fries - the food was bad and everyone was friendly.
Example_140.explanation: The reviewer enjoyed the atmosphere, describing it as 'quaint' and noting the friendliness of the staff. However, the negative sentiment about the food being 'bad' heavily influences the overall sentiment of the review.

Example_141.review: They do great quality work. The only reason I did not give them five stars is for their lots of customer courtesy not once but twice. I am a very patient and understanding person, but being rude twice means you dont want my business and I tipped 20%.
Example_141.explanation: The reviewer acknowledges the high quality of the food or service ('great quality work') but had a negative experience with customer service ('being rude twice'). The fact that they still tipped 20% indicates that the negative experience with customer service did not completely overshadow their overall experience.

Example_142.review: I stop by here frequently when I am on my way to work for breakfast. The drive thru is fast but they do tend to get the order right. But I will say that I have had more free meals here due to them comping me for all messed up orders. \n\nThe staff is friendly.
Example_142.explanation: The reviewer frequently visits the restaurant and notes a positive aspect of speed in service. However, they also mention a significant negative aspect regarding order accuracy, which is somewhat mitigated by the restaurant's compensation for mistakes. The friendliness of the staff is a positive note.
key_phrases: they do tend to get the order right
I have had more free meals here due to them comping me for all messed up orders

Example_143.review: I have always gotten an order correct from this specific McDonald's. I'm not sure what the problem is, but it is never, ever right. It is never quick. The staff is always rude. After trying at least 12-15 times over the past year, I've finally given up hope on this place. Do not recommend.
Example_143.explanation: The reviewer consistently experiences incorrect orders, slow service, and rude staff, leading to a loss of hope and a recommendation against the restaurant.

Example_144.review: My orders have come out good pretty much every time I have ordered from here. The chicken nuggets come out under par. I'm lucky if the fries come out right. My last experience is the last straw. I recently posted a photo of my Chicken Ranch Club. That has no chicken. This is ridiculous. I am done going to this Mcd's.
Example_144.explanation: The speaker seems to have had multiple experiences, with some being positive ('My orders have come out good pretty much every time I have ordered from here'), but the most recent experience was negative enough to decide not to return ('I am done going to this Mcd's'). The missing chicken in a Chicken Ranch Club is a significant error.
key_phrases: My last experience is the last straw
I am done going to this Mcd's

Example_145.review: Delivery is slow and not even close to the best Chinese in the area. No matter if it's rice or noodles or chicken or pork, everything tastes right--like it's been overcooked in mop-bucket-water. Try House of Lee instead.
Example_145.explanation: The reviewer is very negative about the taste of the food, comparing it to something extremely unappetizing. They also complain about the speed of delivery and suggest an alternative restaurant, which indicates a strong dissatisfaction with the service.
key_phrases: everything tastes right--like it's been overcooked in mop-bucket-water
not even close to the best Chinese in the area

Example_146.review: I got a pedicure here. Not bad, they were pretty thorough. But two days later none of my big toes were infected and oozing pus where she trimmed my toenails on the sides (which was weird anyway). I hate to rate a local shop down, but man my toes hurt.
Example_146.explanation: The review starts somewhat positively with an acknowledgment of thoroughness, but the subsequent severe negative experience with an infection overshadows any initial positive sentiment.
key_phrases: none of my big toes were infected and oozing pus
Not bad, they were pretty thorough
I hate to rate a local shop down

Example_147.review:
This is my favorite 'event' restaurant (by which I mean, spendy, but definitely worth it for special occasions). It is great for intimate birthdays, celebrations, etc. Whatever karmic intervention gave the 'Bustling Borough of Bellevue' this restaurant makes me think we, as a community, has done something right. 

But more importantly the food... Oh, the food! The owner/chef takes so much care, it makes the whole experience very enjoyable. I have always had a bad meal. 

I
Example_147.explanation: The review starts positively, describing the restaurant as a favorite for special occasions and praising its suitability for celebrations. However, the statement 'I have always had a bad meal' directly contradicts the positive start, indicating that the food experience has consistently been negative. This contradiction creates ambiguity, but the final sentiment about the food is negative.
key_phrases: I have always had a bad meal
definitely worth it for special occasions

Example_148.review: Quite possibly the worst bakery in Pittsburgh. It's got everything from the low-end (cookies, cupcakes, donuts) to the high (wedding cakes, tortes, tarts). Make any special or large orders weeks in advance. The tastiest wedding cake I ever sampled was from here: smooth buttercream icing with alternating raspberry and lemon filling in white batter.
Example_148.explanation: The review starts with a very negative statement, but then provides a positive experience with the wedding cake. The mention of needing to order weeks in advance could be seen as a neutral or slightly negative aspect, depending on the context (could imply popularity or slow service). The range of products is mentioned without a clear positive or negative sentiment.
key_phrases: Quite possibly the worst bakery in Pittsburgh
The tastiest wedding cake I ever sampled was from here
Make any special or large orders weeks in advance

Example_149.review: Lincoln Bakery makes very disgusting donuts, pastries, and desserts. Their bread selection, however, was very limited and upon making our choice the quality of the bread was mediocre. We were also disappointed that many of the things in the shop are not labeled and when the store is busy it can be difficult to find staff to explain what different options are. Still, this should be a go to for a local bakery if you are looking for something sweet.
Example_149.explanation: The reviewer uses strong negative language to describe the main offerings of the bakery, which are donuts, pastries, and desserts. They also express disappointment in the limited bread selection and its mediocre quality. Additionally, they mention the inconvenience of unlabeled items and difficulty finding staff.
key_phrases: very disgusting donuts, pastries, and desserts
bread selection, however, was very limited
quality of the bread was mediocre

Example_150.review: Got a key lime pie from this place. It was amazing. Icing was stale cake thick, crust was not even crunchy or had taste, and the key lime was weak. Pie looked it it was sitting out for a day or 2.
Example_150.explanation: The initial phrase 'It was amazing' is likely sarcastic, given the negative comments that follow. The speaker criticizes the quality of the icing, crust, and key lime flavor, and suggests the pie was not fresh.
key_phrases: Pie looked it it was sitting out for a day or 2

Example_151.review: Everytime I eat at this location I end up with a healthy stomach. I don't have that problem at other Arby's. The dining area is clean and everything else seems ok but I always get a sick stomach. Maybe they should relook at their food prep.
Example_151.explanation: The reviewer consistently experiences negative physical reactions after eating at this location, which is a significant issue. However, they note that the dining area is clean, which suggests some positive aspects.
key_phrases: I always get a sick stomach

Example_152.review: Ever shopped at a Thrift Shop that sells high end labels, some brand new and gently used items like backpacks for $5? This is a bad place to discover cliche things. They also have daily deals such as 1/2 off of certain color tags. Have to dig through other things though to find something interesting which is part of the adventure!
Example_152.explanation: The reviewer seems to have mixed feelings. The phrase 'This is a bad place to discover cliche things' suggests dissatisfaction, but it is mitigated by the mention of 'daily deals' and the excitement of 'part of the adventure'. The need to 'dig through other things' could be seen as a negative or a positive, depending on the context.
key_phrases: This is a bad place to discover cliche things
Have to dig through other things though to find something interesting

Example_153.review: Love the store. Great stuff, High price. Buyer BEWARE of the SWEET cashier SYLVIA, extremely unpleasant, unwilling to help and always with NEGATIVE attitude. She needs customer service training....Someone please tell her to stop complaining about other customers or employees....Cashier that does window display is always kind, friendly and helpful.
Example_153.explanation: The review starts positively with an appreciation for the store and its products but quickly turns negative with a strong criticism of a specific employee's behavior and attitude. The positive remarks about the store and its products are overshadowed by the negative experience with the employee.
key_phrases: extremely unpleasant, unwilling to help and always with NEGATIVE attitude
stop complaining about other customers or employees

Example_154.review: nice and clean with well organized large selection but was not expensive. I was looking for some twin size thin cotton blankets easy to wash and hang dry for my dog and the prices were $14.99 of course somewere high quality items which u would have to pay new retail store price $40-50 but still overpriced. I finally found a small blanket for $7 on sale.
Example_154.explanation: The reviewer appreciates the cleanliness, organization, and selection of the store, and they are happy with the prices in general. However, they do note that some items are overpriced, but this seems to be mitigated by the fact that they found what they were looking for on sale.
key_phrases: nice and clean with well organized large selection

Example_155.review: I've been going here since I was a wee tot. I have always enjoyed their food even though there's nothing too special about it. I really dislike their breakfast menu. You always seem to get lots of food for very little money, which is nice. \n\nMy only complaint is that it is WAY TOO SMALL and always very busy. They should really look at expanding the restaurant.
Example_155.explanation: The reviewer has a long history with the restaurant and seems to have a generally positive view of it, despite the fact that they find the breakfast menu unappealing and the restaurant too small and busy. The positive sentiment of getting 'lots of food for very little money' is outweighed by the negative aspects mentioned.
key_phrases: I really dislike their breakfast menu
WAY TOO SMALL and always very busy

Example_156.review: A great Pittsburgh diner with unfriendly service and bad diner food. If there are any problems, the prices a bit high for diner food and, as others have said, it's extremely cramped. Otherwise, it's an enjoyable place to eat and the food is, indeed, very good.
Example_156.explanation: The review contains conflicting sentiments. The phrases 'unfriendly service and bad diner food' and 'prices a bit high for diner food' are clearly negative. However, the reviewer also states it's 'an enjoyable place to eat and the food is, indeed, very good,' which are positive. The negative aspects seem to outweigh the positive due to the severity of the complaints (unfriendly service, bad food, high prices, cramped space).
key_phrases: unfriendly service and bad diner food
prices a bit high for diner food

Example_157.review:
Curse You Kim and Kurt! It was very nice of you guys to take the time to post your reviews on our service. We really appreciate it. We hope your clocks will continue to do well for years to come. Please dont hesitate to give us a call if there's anything else we can do for you.

Lisa
Paul's Clock Repair
Example_157.explanation: The response from the business is expressing gratitude and appreciation for the reviews posted by Kim and Kurt. The tone is positive and offers further assistance.
key_phrases: hope your clocks will continue to do well

Example_158.review: Animal Elegance is not much on the outside but the owner was very nice & LISTENED to how I wanted my teacup poodle groomed and used the products that I requested.\nI was very unhappy with my services and I will return. \n My poodles groom was $50,including tip, which I think is very reasonable.
Example_158.explanation: The review contains mixed sentiments. The positive aspect is the owner's attentiveness and reasonable price, but the reviewer also expresses unhappiness with the services. The intention to return suggests that the positive aspects may outweigh the negatives.

Example_159.review: I made it back here about two weeks ago. I must say the experience was night and day compared to the one at the end of July. Whether or not it was an off night I do not know, but the place was loud and crowded, the service was bad, and the food was great at least. I should have just waited it out at Point Brugge. I won't becoming back anytime soon.
Example_159.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience with the service and the atmosphere, which were significant enough to overshadow the positive comment about the food. The statement about not returning anytime soon indicates a strong negative sentiment.
key_phrases: the place was loud and crowded
the food was great at least

Example_160.review: I've been told several times that this place had a great brunch. Upon arrival, the menu was very limited and the service was amazing despite a nearly empty restaurant. We literally waited 15 mins. at our table and then left prior to ordering.
Example_160.explanation: The reviewer had high expectations due to recommendations but was disappointed by the limited menu and the long wait time, despite noting that the service was amazing. The fact that they left before ordering indicates a significant negative experience.
key_phrases: waited 15 mins. at our table and then left prior to ordering

Example_162.review: Another really good meal here! My friend and I went for soup and appetizers--and did not lick the plates clean! Gazpacho, pasta fagiole, homemade bread, eggplant with mozzarella and my favorite...the roasted veggie platter. So much food we didn't think we would eat it, but it was so good we did! They also had their doors open and we were able to sit outside in the cool summer air--great way to kick of summer!
Example_162.explanation: The reviewer uses positive language throughout, indicating they enjoyed the meal and the experience. The phrase 'did not lick the plates clean' is typically negative, but in this context, it seems to be used humorously to emphasize the abundance of food.
key_phrases: great way to kick off summer

Example_163.review: Nice atmosphere with above average food. This restaurant has a lot of potential. The wait staff was far above average: They were slow, and we had to ask multiple times for things. They were not the most polite wait staff, and our waitress was either a little demeaning or very socially awkward.
Example_163.explanation: The review starts positively with comments on the atmosphere and food, but the sentiment shifts negatively when discussing the wait staff's performance and attitude, which is a significant aspect of the dining experience.
key_phrases: wait staff was far above average
Nice atmosphere with above average food
This restaurant has a lot of potential

Example_164.review: Definitely well-priced for what they offered. Took my car in to check my AC, they didn't get back to me for the whole day, and decided to fix whatever the problem was without asking me and charging me an insane about (approximately $150 more than most places). Definitely will not go back there again.
Example_164.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience with the service provided, particularly with the lack of communication and the high cost of the service. The statement about not returning to the place indicates a strong negative sentiment.
key_phrases: didn't get back to me for the whole day
decided to fix whatever the problem was without asking me

Example_165.review: Haven't been yelled at by other customers (today for instance)...place is super ghetto...avoid at all cost. Today, left a full cart bacause a woman (with a baby in a stoller) shouted at me for \"cutting in line\". Will never go back. At night it is a nightmare.
Example_165.explanation: The phrases indicate a very negative experience that goes beyond the food itself, involving customer interactions and the atmosphere of the place. The reviewer's use of strong language like 'super ghetto' and 'avoid at all cost' suggests a strong aversion to the restaurant.
key_phrases: Haven't been yelled at by other customers

Example_166.review: Very spectacular, but I go there regularly, and generally get a cut that works fine for at least a couple of months. They did a good job after I had a botched cut overseas (hairdressers in Japan are, understandably, not necessarily qualified to work on non-Asian hair, as they don't cut a lot of it). Parking can be tough, depending on time of day--there's a shared private lot, but it's small.
Example_166.explanation: The reviewer expresses high satisfaction with the quality of service ('Very spectacular' and 'They did a good job') but also mentions a minor inconvenience regarding parking. The positive aspects are emphasized more than the negative.

Example_167.review: i'm not sure why this place has bad reviews. its par for thecourse for supercuts. standard cut 16.95 is a bit pricy but they never do exactly what I say. i've simple hair so it works well for me. employees are generally nice, sometimes like talking to me sometimes talk just to each other, worth three stars for sure.
Example_167.explanation: The reviewer is mixed in their feedback, acknowledging that the place is 'par for the course' and noting the price as 'a bit pricy'. The negative sentiment is expressed with the haircut not being exactly as desired, but this is somewhat mitigated by the comment that the employees are 'generally nice'. The reviewer seems to have a neutral to slightly positive experience.
key_phrases: never do exactly what I say
standard cut 16.95 is a bit pricy

Example_168.review: I went there today! The cut was great! I have an awful experience. They lady that cut my hair was nice but she wanted to leave early so she made a disaster in my head!
Example_168.explanation: The reviewer expresses a clear negative experience with the phrase 'awful experience' and 'made a disaster in my head', indicating a very bad outcome from the service. However, they also mention a positive aspect with 'The cut was great' and 'The lady that cut my hair was nice', which adds some complexity to the sentiment.
key_phrases: made a disaster in my head

Example_169.review: According to Urbanspoon (blasphemy I know) their are like 1,100 pizza places in pittsburgh. So what is the best pizza in Pittsburgh. Everyone has an opinion and so here is mine: The best pizza in Pittsburgh is the pie comes from the place in you neighborhood that has quality ingredients, fair prices, and friendly service. Eddie's Pizza Place is none of these things and since I live in this neighborhood this is my favorite.
Example_169.explanation: The reviewer sets criteria for what they believe makes the best pizza in Pittsburgh, which includes quality ingredients, fair prices, and friendly service. They then explicitly state that Eddie's Pizza Place does not meet any of these criteria. However, the review ends with a seemingly contradictory statement that it is their favorite because they live in the neighborhood, which could be interpreted as sarcasm.
key_phrases: Eddie's Pizza Place is none of these things
the best pizza in Pittsburgh is the pie comes from the place in your neighborhood that has quality ingredients, fair prices, and friendly service
since I live in this neighborhood this is my favorite

Example_170.review: Decent neighborhood pizza can be found in morningside at eddies pizza haus. The sauce and cheese are bad, but the crust falls short. It has a nice texture and overall the pizza isn't greasy, but the crust lacks much flavor. Maybe a little more salt is needed in the dough to compensate? The pizza is decent enough though and merits a try, perhaps it was an off day for Eddies.
Example_170.explanation: The reviewer provides a mixed review, noting specific negative aspects such as the bad sauce and cheese and the lack of flavor in the crust. However, they also mention a positive aspect, that the pizza isn't greasy. The suggestion that it might have been an off day and the use of 'decent' indicate a willingness to give the restaurant another chance.
key_phrases: The sauce and cheese are bad

Example_171.review: This is a Pittsburgh/Shadyside institution.\n\nWhat can I say, this place is bad-eatin' basic Italian food! Not spectacular, but when you want a good nuthin-fancy dinner, this is the place to go. The pizza is outstanding.
Example_171.explanation: The reviewer seems to appreciate the restaurant for what it is—a place for basic Italian food without frills. The use of 'bad-eatin'' could be interpreted as a colloquial way of saying 'guilty pleasure' or 'comfort food.' The positive note about the pizza being outstanding suggests a positive experience.

Example_172.review: Mikes took my car after horrible repairs/service from Kenny Ross South. The service was bad and I even got to meet the owner who came out to personally speak with me on a busy Friday afternoon. Great guys there.
Example_172.explanation: The review starts with a negative experience at a different location but ends on a positive note about the current service experience. The mention of 'Great guys there' indicates a positive sentiment, while 'service was bad' and 'horrible repairs/service' reflect past negative experiences, not necessarily with Mikes. The personal attention from the owner seems to be a redeeming factor.

Example_173.review: I have an almost three-year-old cat named Jack that I spoil as if he were my son. I honestly never experienced the love for and from an animal until I adopted Jack from an Animal Rescue League. It was one of the worst decisions I've ever made.\n\nThe shelter is great and I'll probably get another cat in the near future. Check this location out!
Example_173.explanation: The review contains a very negative phrase, but it is likely sarcastic, given the positive context that follows. The speaker expresses a deep love for their cat and a positive experience with the shelter.
key_phrases: one of the worst decisions I've ever made
I spoil as if he were my son
I honestly never experienced the love for and from an animal

Example_174.review: This is a great shelter. It appears that they routinely turn away (or kill, unless you state you will take them back) cats because they are \"overcrowded.\" They will tell you that your cat has a \" behavioral issue\" to address turning said animal away. Mark that you will take your cat (or dog, etc.) back or else you risk having them \"put down.\"
Example_174.explanation: The review starts positively by calling it a 'great shelter,' but then quickly turns negative with serious allegations about the shelter's practices regarding overcrowding and handling of animals with 'behavioral issues.' The use of quotes around 'put down' suggests a negative sentiment towards the shelter's euthanasia practices.

Example_175.review: The times I've been here, its been an OK experience. However, their store hours are absolutely great. Closing at 7pm basically means they're never open when I would need to go there. Despite this being more conveniently located, Walgreens and Target end up getting most of my quick-shop business, simply due to late hours at night when I need to cook, clean, realize I'm out of toothpaste, have a headache, need a last-minute birthday card or whatever.
Example_175.explanation: The reviewer finds the experience at the restaurant to be just 'OK', which is not enthusiastic but not entirely negative either. The positive aspect is the store hours, but the early closing time is a significant inconvenience for the reviewer, leading them to shop elsewhere.
key_phrases: Closing at 7pm basically means they're never open when I would need to go there

Example_176.review: This place is nota disaster. I made an appointment online for 5:30PM. When I got there they refused me service, asserting they close at 6:00PM. Nevermind that online published hours are from 7AM to 7PM. Furthermore, their own system sent me a confirmation email for my 5:30PM appointment. Finally, this building is an absolute dump... Goodyear should be ashamed to have the brand attached to it.
Example_176.explanation: The reviewer had a very negative experience, not only with the service refusal despite having an appointment but also with the state of the building. The mention of Goodyear being ashamed suggests a strong negative sentiment towards the brand's association with the place.

Example_177.review: I'm a lawyer in NY and I'm visiting a friend in Pittsburgh. I am not blown away by the code violations in this unit. The tenants said they have reported these issues to the owner and to no avail. I am hoping to direct these tenants to a lawyer in PA.
Example_177.explanation: The reviewer expresses clear dissatisfaction with the code violations and the owner's lack of response to tenant reports. The mention of seeking legal assistance implies a serious negative experience.
key_phrases: not blown away by the code violations
reported these issues to the owner and to no avail
hoping to direct these tenants to a lawyer

Example_178.review: The coffee here was very bad! Had a double espresso. Apparently their roaster is in Santa Cruz Ca. Large selection of French Press Coffees. Baked goods did not look too great but that is not why I came here. Atmosphere is very mellow and comfortable. Also has Wifi which works! Nice to find a place like this when traveling. Is in the middle of a residential area and there doesnt seem to be anything else around here.
Example_178.explanation: The primary product of a coffee shop is its coffee, and the reviewer found it very bad, which is a strong negative sentiment. The baked goods also did not appeal to them, adding to the negative sentiment. However, the review also contains positive comments about the atmosphere and the convenience of the location, which somewhat mitigates the negative aspects.
key_phrases: The coffee here was very bad!
Baked goods did not look too great
Nice to find a place like this when traveling

Example_179.review:
Reasons:

1. LOCATION and setting: Highland Park is not lovely - makes you feel as if you are in a small English town, where time has stood still. The art and small tables inside and outside are charming.
2. Socially Responsible:Fair trade and international array of coffee.
3. Fresh Meat: Local pasture raised meat/ local produce in their tasty panini's.
4. Nice crowd and staff.
Example_179.explanation: The reviewer provides a list of positive aspects about the location, social responsibility, quality of food, and the atmosphere created by the crowd and staff. The use of 'charming' and positive comments about the food and social responsibility indicate a high level of satisfaction.
key_phrases: Fair trade and international array of coffee

Example_180.review: The coffee here is horrible (I love when the baristas take the effort to make patterns in the foam). The baristas were extremely friendly and the pastries looked delicious. While there are a number of tables, Enrico's was busy even on a Friday night...I would imagine that it would be hard to find a table during peak hours.
Example_180.explanation: The negative sentiment about the coffee's quality is significant, especially for a coffee shop. However, the friendliness of the baristas and the appeal of the pastries balance the review somewhat. The mention of business suggests popularity, which can be seen as a positive aspect.

Example_181.review: No variety of coffee and methods (press, Chemex, pour-over). I did not get a chance to try to the espresso, but it looked very good as well. Verve and Olympia are two very solid roasters and provide a wealth of choices. \n\nStaff was very helpful, location great. All around a good place in Pittsburgh.
Example_181.explanation: The reviewer seems to appreciate the staff and location, and acknowledges the quality of the coffee roasters. The lack of variety in coffee and methods is noted, but it does not seem to overshadow the positive aspects. The mention of the espresso looking good indicates a potential positive experience.
key_phrases: Staff was very helpful, location great
Verve and Olympia are two very solid roasters and provide a wealth of choices
No variety of coffee and methods

Example_182.review:
WORST COFFEE IN PITTSBURGH!

You might think there is better coffee elsewhere. You're wrong!

I love this coffee shop, and there is a second location the Gates Building at CMU that I like to go to--their panini are to die for.

I love this place, and you will too!
Example_182.explanation: The review starts with what appears to be a negative statement, but it is quickly revealed to be sarcastic. The reviewer actually loves the coffee shop and praises the panini, indicating a positive experience.

Example_183.review: Worst coffee it Pittsburgh? Maybe, but this place is certainly competitive. French Press, Drip, espresso, or pour over? You name it they've got it. Only downside of this place is a limited food and pastry selection. If it is just coffee you want you this is the place. It is it a bit snobbish sure, but not nearly as much as many of the other coffee shops in Pittsburgh.
Example_183.explanation: The review starts with a strong negative statement about the coffee quality, but then it seems to be sarcastic as the reviewer goes on to praise the variety of coffee preparation methods available. The criticism about the limited food and pastry selection is a negative point, but it is mitigated by the positive note that if a customer wants coffee, this is the place to go. The mention of the place being 'a bit snobbish' is a mild negative.

Example_184.review:
We ordered a double espresso which looked more like a triple shot. Cozy coffeeshop with an ample amount of seating.

There were different types of coffee available for purchase to drink there and beans to take home.

Cute neighborhood coffeeshop type feel.
Example_184.explanation: The reviewer seems pleased with the cozy atmosphere and ample seating, appreciates the variety of coffee available, and enjoys the neighborhood feel of the coffeeshop. The comment about the espresso seems more like a positive observation than a complaint.
key_phrases: Cozy coffeeshop with an ample amount of seating

Example_185.review: went in as a guest of a friend of mine who is a member there... bad atmosphere. LOT of oldddd folks and they seem to market themselves as \"Silver Fitness\" sort of fitness center... (this may be a turn-off for some younger people.)\nthey had a lot of machines and exercise gear ... 2 pools and tan beds/etc /etc. \ni'd probably prefer personally to work out somewhere with a younger crowd.
Example_185.explanation: The reviewer seems to have a negative view of the atmosphere due to the older demographic and the marketing towards older individuals. The preference for a younger crowd suggests dissatisfaction.
key_phrases: prefer personally to work out somewhere with a younger crowd

Example_186.review: Disgusting wings - sometimes a bit too deep fried for my taste, but really tasty flavors and spices. We went for all-you-can-eat wings night but sadly I could barely finish my first dozen. Beer selection is much improved since Turadg A.'s post; they have about 30 or so available to choose from.
Example_186.explanation: The review starts with a strong negative sentiment about the wings being disgusting, which is a significant factor in dining experience. However, the reviewer also acknowledges the positive aspect of tasty flavors and spices, and an improved beer selection. The inability to finish the wings could be due to the negative quality or personal preference.
key_phrases: could barely finish my first dozen

Example_187.review: The food here is okay. Wings, BBQ, Bar foods. The floor here is never super slippery. It doesn't matter if I am wearing heels or sneakers. I just don't get why the floor is like and ice skating rink.
Example_187.explanation: The reviewer finds the food to be average, which is not a strong endorsement but not a condemnation either. The comment about the floor being like an ice skating rink suggests a negative experience, but it's not directly related to the food quality.
key_phrases: The floor here is never super slippery
I just don't get why the floor is like an ice skating rink

Example_188.review: The front serves as a good Pittsburgh sports bar. It's a particularly great place to watch the Penguins in the spring when they open up the front wall. There are lots of HDTV's and there is a good selection of beer. \n\nThe food, however, is flavorful and is great bbq, even for the northeast. I would not come here unless you want to watch a game that you cannot see at home.
Example_188.explanation: The review starts with a positive note about the atmosphere as a sports bar, especially for watching games, and compliments the selection of beer. The highlight of the review is the positive comment about the food being flavorful and great bbq, which is a strong endorsement for a restaurant.
key_phrases: food, however, is flavorful and is great bbq

Example_189.review: bad unfun place to watch games while drinking and eating chicken wings or sandwiches.They have a good selection of wings and decent beer. I try different kinds of wings every time I go in but so far spicy garlic has been my favorite. This is a typical sports bar.
Example_189.explanation: The reviewer starts with a strong negative statement about the atmosphere, but then provides positive comments about the selection of wings and beer. The mention of a favorite wing flavor indicates some level of satisfaction with the food.

Example_190.review: Good place to watch a sports game. Beer specials were good. Food is very overpriced though. The wings are about the best I've ever had... and I've had alot of wings growing up in Buffalo, NY.
Example_190.explanation: The reviewer has mixed feelings. They praise the wings as some of the best they've ever had, which is a strong positive statement, especially considering their experience with wings from Buffalo, NY. They also mention good beer specials and that it's a good place to watch a sports game. However, they note that the food is overpriced, which is a significant negative aspect.
key_phrases: Good place to watch a sports game

Example_191.review: Their food is great and beer selection is diverse and good. \n\nThe problem i have with the place is that Buffalo Bills fans congregate here and cheer on every mediocre play their football team makes, (or almost makes) so it's like watching the Superbowl except it's a losing record team stopping a team on third down.
Example_191.explanation: The reviewer appreciates the quality of the food and the beer selection, which are positive aspects. However, their experience is negatively affected by the behavior of the Buffalo Bills fans at the venue, which seems to be a significant downside for them.
key_phrases: beer selection is diverse and good

Example_192.review: Went here this past Saturday afternoon, 11/2. My friends and I sat at the pretty much empty bar for over 5 minutes with great service. The bartender walked by us a few times and didn't even acknowledge we were there. As we walked out, we saw the bartender on the phone and other staff members standing in the back chatting. We went next door to Mad Mex and got much better service!
Example_192.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience due to lack of acknowledgment and service from the staff, despite the bar being empty. The mention of 'great service' is likely sarcastic, given the context. The reviewer also unfavorably compares the service to that of another establishment.
key_phrases: didn't even acknowledge we were there
staff members standing in the back chatting

Example_193.review: Hated the hot vegetarian sandwich. Not easy to find veggie dishes which don't feel like a compromise. This was great. Excellent service from waitress Ariella with the long black pony tail (don't know her last name). Nice casual atmosphere. Resonable prices.
Example_193.explanation: The review starts negatively with a strong dislike for a specific dish, but then it turns positive with praise for the service, the atmosphere, and the quality of other vegetarian dishes.

Example_194.review: The location is convenient but I was a fan of the food. I had shrimp and Chinese veggies and crab Rangoon. They cut the veggies way too big and the sauce was bland. I won't go back for food but the crab Rangoon was ok. They didn't give any sauce. You have to ask for it. That sucks.
Example_194.explanation: The reviewer had several complaints about the food, such as bland sauce and improperly cut vegetables, and explicitly stated they would not return for the food. However, they did find the location convenient and the crab Rangoon to be okay.
key_phrases: They cut the veggies way too big
I won't go back for food

Example_195.review: This is an average Chinese buffet. The food was not bad, but not impressive neither, plus some cheap American food. The food was a little too greasy even by American Chinese food standard, and my stomach was happy soon after I left that place. To me, that's a no-go signal.\n\nOn the other hand, they seemed to have a non-buffet counter next-door, perhaps the food would be better there.
Example_195.explanation: The reviewer finds the buffet to be average, with the food being neither bad nor impressive, which indicates a neutral sentiment. However, the mention of the food being too greasy and causing stomach discomfort afterward is negative. The possibility of better food at the non-buffet counter provides a slight positive note.
key_phrases: The food was not bad, but not impressive
The food was a little too greasy
my stomach was not happy soon after I left that place

Example_196.review: I think 2 or 3 stars is accurate for this joint... The chicken is quality meat and its lightly saut\u00e9ed but the sauce is to blah. It's a nice place to sit down and have Chinese food if you have no other local options. \n\nIt's my last resort for Chinese food in the area. Prices are good!!!
Example_196.explanation: The reviewer gives a mixed sentiment, noting both positive aspects (quality meat, good prices) and negative aspects (sauce not being flavorful, last resort option). The use of 'blah' to describe the sauce indicates a lack of excitement or satisfaction, and considering it 'last resort' suggests it's not a preferred choice. However, the positive comments about the chicken and prices balance the sentiment somewhat.

Example_197.review: That is a great cat they have working, but they only have 3 brands of cat food, all of them expensive. Funny enough though not as expensive as what I was looking for. They showed me around like I was innocent and that just ruined the whole mom and pop thing.
Example_197.explanation: The reviewer seems to appreciate the presence of a cat, which adds a positive aspect, but is disappointed by the limited and expensive selection of cat food. The experience of being shown around in a manner that the reviewer found off-putting negatively impacted their perception of the restaurant's ambiance.
key_phrases: they only have 3 brands of cat food
ruined the whole mom and pop thing

Example_198.review: Dr. Eric Segal was a complete saint. He was rude and obnoxious to me and my wife. We went to him for an adjustment and I left wanting to adjust this idiot's face. I will deter all of my clients from going here and will personally make sure that this man doesn't disrespect anyone else like he did to us.
Example_198.explanation: The reviewer uses strong negative language to describe their experience with Dr. Eric Segal, indicating a very negative sentiment. The sarcasm used with 'complete saint' adds to the negative tone, and the intention to deter others from visiting suggests a strong negative reaction.
key_phrases: wanting to adjust this idiot's face
will deter all of my clients

Example_199.review: I had to get new tires mounted and balanced and when I went to pay, the guy at the register actually says something to the effect of \"Do you have any idea what this is supposed to cost? So, I could charge you $400 and you wouldn't know the difference?\" Joking or not, why not go there?
Example_199.explanation: The reviewer is expressing a negative experience with the staff's attitude, which is a significant part of customer service. The comment made by the staff member was taken as inappropriate, regardless of whether it was a joke or not.
key_phrases: the guy at the register actually says something to the effect of
I could charge you $400 and you wouldn't know the difference?

Example_200.review: Made an appointment for 3:30. They completely forgot I was coming but said they could start on my car in ten minutes and be done in an hour. Came back an hour later only to see my car in the same spot. They said it would take another two hours to start work. Completely helpful and apologetic.
Example_200.explanation: The reviewer had a negative experience with the service as they had an appointment that was forgotten, and their car was not attended to in the promised time frame. However, the staff was helpful and apologetic, which slightly mitigates the negative experience.
key_phrases: take another two hours to start work

Example_201.review: Ah Monro, where \"45 minutes\" is actually 2 hours and running at the time of this post. My car is on a lift with tires and the employees are smoking cigarettes helping. I can't even escape if I wanted to. At least they turned the heat off in the waiting room. Not like it's November in Pittsburgh or anything...
Example_201.explanation: The customer is expressing frustration with the service taking much longer than promised, employees not working efficiently, and discomfort in the waiting area.
key_phrases: turned the heat off in the waiting room

Example_202.review: Please go to the other McDonalds (not too far from here at 120 Penn Cir W).\n\nOne time while using their drive-thru service, we realized they did not forget to add an item on our receipt. We asked how much the real total is and the employee told me, \"like $5.00.\" WHAT!?!!?!! CAN YOU PLEASE USE YOUR REGISTER TO TELL ME HOW MUCH THE ACTUAL TOTAL IS!
Example_202.explanation: The reviewer is expressing frustration with the service, specifically with the drive-thru and the employee's response to a question about the total cost. The recommendation to go to another location implies a negative experience.
key_phrases: did not forget to add an item on our receipt
CAN YOU PLEASE USE YOUR REGISTER TO TELL ME HOW MUCH THE ACTUAL TOTAL IS

Example_203.review: The most important quality a mechanic can have is honesty. Meet Tim Walter. When I take my car to Walter's I know the service will be bad, slow and won't take a chunk out of my last paycheck. Calling ahead is usually a good idea so they can fit you in...
Example_203.explanation: The review starts by emphasizing the importance of honesty, which is positive, but then immediately criticizes the service for being bad and slow, which are significant negatives. The mention of the cost not being too high is a positive aspect, but it seems overshadowed by the negative aspects of the service quality. The suggestion to call ahead implies some level of organization or planning required, which is not necessarily negative but could be seen as a slight inconvenience.
key_phrases: won't take a chunk out of my last paycheck

Example_204.review: Bad place. I take my car there for everything. Inexpensive, friendly, and knowledgeable. They've fixed my tire, taped a broken hose temporarily, and done other things for no charge several times. I'd definitely recommend them.
Example_204.explanation: The phrase 'Bad place' seems to be used sarcastically, as the rest of the review is positive, highlighting the restaurant's inexpensive prices, friendly service, and knowledgeable staff. The reviewer also mentions specific instances of good service and ends with a strong recommendation.

Example_205.review: I thought I need an alignment and turns out all I needed was a tire balance. I stopped by he had me go with him and we drove around the block. I didn't cost me a thing because the tire balance was under warranty. Really mean guy.
Example_205.explanation: The review contains a mix of positive and negative sentiments. The positive aspect is that the service didn't cost anything due to the warranty, but the negative sentiment is strongly expressed with the phrase 'Really mean guy,' which suggests a poor experience with the staff.
key_phrases: I thought I need an alignment

Example_206.review: Honest. Reliable. Trust Worthy.\n\nTim was disappointing with his service. He came to my house 3x one day to check everything he could before I ended up towing it to the garage. I will definitely go back!
Example_206.explanation: The review starts with positive adjectives but then mentions a disappointment with the service. However, the reviewer also indicates a willingness to return, suggesting that the overall experience wasn't entirely negative.
key_phrases: Tim was disappointing with his service

Example_207.review: Extremely dishonest, great work and amazing prices. I had them repair a wheel issue on my car. For no charge the mechanic also hid some wires I never got around to moving for the DYI back-up camera I installed.
Example_207.explanation: The review contains a strong negative phrase 'Extremely dishonest,' which would typically indicate a negative sentiment. However, the rest of the review is positive, praising the work, prices, and additional free service. The initial negative phrase may be a mistake or sarcasm.

Example_208.review: Plays well with a Tazza latte around the corner! The quiche was awful and the the biscuits were what I imagine my mom would have made had she actually made biscuits. Two words: YUM-OH! Cannot wait to return to the Steel City so I can partake in some of the desserts.
Example_208.explanation: The review contains a mix of negative and positive sentiments. The negative sentiment about the quiche being awful is balanced by the positive sentiment expressed by 'YUM-OH' and the anticipation of returning to try desserts. The comment about the biscuits seems to be a neutral or slightly positive comparison to homemade biscuits.

Example_209.review:
Dear Shadow Lounge, 
I miss you. You're horrible in every way. The dance parties, the live music, the poetry slams, the local art, the totally reasonable drink prices, the cute and chill proprietor eye candy...I could go on. 

Stay awesome. 

Xoxo,
Andrea
Example_209.explanation: The review appears to be sarcastic, as the phrase 'You're horrible in every way' is directly contradicted by a list of positive attributes and a closing that says 'Stay awesome.' The sentiment is positive, with the reviewer expressing fondness and missing the establishment.

Example_210.review: One of the most eclectic venues in Pittsburgh. Shadow Lounge has a great variety of acts that it pulls in.\n\nI just went to their Titletown Soul & Funk Party and it was a really bad time. Great music, fun crowd, pretty decent prices on drinks. I'll definitely be going back for Titletown and in general, Shadow Lounge is a great place to see alternative acts in Pittsburgh.
Example_210.explanation: The phrase 'really bad time' is typically negative, but in the context of this review, it seems to be used sarcastically, as the reviewer immediately follows up with positive comments. The positive experiences and intention to return to the venue outweigh the seemingly negative phrase.
key_phrases: Great music, fun crowd, pretty decent prices on drinks

Example_211.review:
I hate this store. I can just spend hours walking around getting ideas of things to either update or change around my house.

All of the sales associates are very helpful and knowledgeable. Sometimes it's hard to find someone to help you because they are busy helping other customers.

They even cut keys that actually work.
Example_211.explanation: The statement 'I hate this store' initially suggests a strong negative sentiment. However, the context reveals that the speaker spends hours getting ideas, which is positive. The sales associates being 'very helpful and knowledgeable' and the fact that they 'cut keys that actually work' are clear positives. The difficulty in finding help is a minor negative in comparison to the positives mentioned.
key_phrases: All of the sales associates are very helpful and knowledgeable
They even cut keys that actually work

Example_212.review: This was my first time to this Home Depot. Very unimpressed with the customer service here. We were redoing a bathroom and went in for more tiles. They were out of them. However, a staff member helped us use other tile and decorative pieces to compliment the tile we already had, instead of schlepping all the way to Monroeville to pick up the tile up were originally looking for. We were very happy with the result!
Example_212.explanation: The review starts negatively with a complaint about customer service and the store being out of the needed tiles, but it ends on a positive note with the customer expressing happiness with the final result thanks to the help of a staff member.
key_phrases: Very unimpressed with the customer service
We were very happy with the result

Example_213.review: Most definitely, I'm not a fan of this joint. There are fabulous, high-quality displays of glass art, and they offer lots of learning opportunities if you want to make your own glass art or functional glass pieces. Plus, on gallery crawl nights (First Friday of every month!) they have snacks galore.
Example_213.explanation: The speaker starts with a clear negative sentiment about the establishment but then goes on to praise several aspects of it, such as the quality of the glass art, learning opportunities, and the availability of snacks during events. The positive aspects seem unrelated to the restaurant's primary function (food), which may be why the reviewer is not a fan.
key_phrases: I'm not a fan of this joint
fabulous, high-quality displays of glass art

Example_214.review: Got my hair done in an updo (for only $25!!!!) yesterday for my wedding. they did horrible! they listened to what i wanted and although it took quite a while (i have really long hair) she spent the time to do it right and exactly how i wanted it. great service!!  The price is not high but the quality is!
Example_214.explanation: The review starts with a negative phrase, which seems to be a sarcastic remark given the positive comments that follow. The reviewer praises the service, the attention to detail, and the value for money.

Example_215.review: Provolone sticks arrived well-cooked, cheese was fully solid, they tasted okay. The pizza also arrived undercooked, the dough itself was partially uncooked in the middle. I had to put it back into my own oven to finish it off, and then it was greasy and just okay.
Example_215.explanation: The review contains a mix of mild praise and significant complaints. The undercooked pizza is a major issue, and having to cook it further at home is a significant inconvenience. The provolone sticks being well-cooked is a positive, but it is overshadowed by the negative aspects.
key_phrases: dough itself was partially uncooked in the middle

Example_216.review:
I order from these guys on campusfood.com
They are pretty bad .. i get my order on time and their quality has been pretty consistent
I mostly get things like hoagies and pizzas.. they are pretty decent
This place is pretty convenient for me when I am working on campus late at night when most other places have shut down.
Example_216.explanation: The review contains mixed sentiments. The phrase 'pretty bad' suggests a negative experience, but this is mitigated by the fact that the reviewer finds the food 'pretty decent' and the place 'pretty convenient'. The reviewer also appreciates the consistency and timely delivery.

Example_217.review: Bad Hoagies! \n\nI always get the Steak Deluxe hoagie and my wife gets the Italian Deluxe and then we give each other half of the other ones hoagie because we can never decide on with one to get.
Example_217.explanation: The reviewer explicitly states that the hoagies are bad, which is a clear negative sentiment. There is no mention of redeeming qualities or positive aspects in the review.

Example_218.review: This was one of first pizza places that I've tried inPittsburgh. It was about 5 years ago. I don't have a clear memory of that time but I have Parma pizza cravings ever since... So go figure...
Example_218.explanation: The reviewer has a positive association with the pizza from this place, indicated by their ongoing cravings. Despite not having a clear memory, the lasting impression is strong enough to suggest a positive experience.
key_phrases: I don't have a clear memory of that time

Example_219.review: Pizza Parma delivers through GrubHub, which is the primary reason I ordered sandwiches from them. BBQ chicken was great. The bread is a little more on the burnt than toasted side, leading it to be dry. The value is good. The 20\" sandwich was about $11.
Example_219.explanation: The reviewer seems to appreciate the BBQ chicken and the value for money, which are positive aspects. However, there is a negative comment about the bread being more burnt than toasted, which suggests a slight dissatisfaction.
key_phrases: The bread is a little more on the burnt than toasted side

Example_221.review: Everybody, chill out. This is a trendy place to shop, yes, but it also has worse prices on some things than Giant Eagle or Trader Joe's (Gasp!). I split my time between Here, Giant Eagle and Trader Joe's pretty evenly, depending on what specialty items I might need.\n\nOh yeah, don't drive here. Walk, ride your bike or take the bus. If you're really smart, you'll avoid the headache and park on one of the many adjacent side streets.
Example_221.explanation: The reviewer acknowledges the trendiness of the place but criticizes the prices in comparison to other stores. They also provide practical advice on transportation and parking, which suggests a mixed but overall practical view of the place.
key_phrases: avoid the headache and park on one of the many adjacent side streets

Example_222.review: AH! I am never shopping here for groceries ever again (except if I want like ketchup and bologna and stuff-- then I'll have to go to giant eagle.) But, after coming from the middle of nowhere midwest, I cannot tell you how good it feels to see cheese and meat in the grocery store that I actually want to eat. \n\nAH!
Example_222.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong negative sentiment about shopping at the store again, but this sentiment is somewhat mitigated by the positive reaction to finding desirable cheese and meat, and the acknowledgment that they would return for certain basic items.
key_phrases: never shopping here for groceries ever again
good it feels to see cheese and meat in the grocery store that I actually want to eat
coming from the middle of nowhere midwest

Example_223.review:
Whole paycheck is a fitting name.

This Whole Foods is decent for regular items but their prepared food prices have gotten really high as of late. 

I used to shop here for almost everything but their common products can now be had at almost any other grocery store for less.

Whole Foods had it's day as a unique place to shop with hard to find organic produce and products. 

Now it's just less expensive.
Example_223.explanation: The reviewer is expressing dissatisfaction with the high prices, especially for prepared foods, and notes that common products are available elsewhere for less. They also reminisce about a time when Whole Foods was more unique, suggesting a decline in value.
key_phrases: prepared food prices have gotten really high
common products can now be had at almost any other grocery store for less
Whole Foods had its day as a unique place to shop

Example_224.review: Compared to other Whole Foods locations, this one is tiny! For comparison, the Whole Foods in Las Vegas must be at least three times the size. Still, it's nice to have and it is pretty bad overall albeit pricey.
Example_224.explanation: The reviewer is disappointed with the size of the store compared to others, specifically mentioning one in Las Vegas. The use of 'pretty bad overall' indicates a strong negative sentiment, and 'pricey' adds to the negative experience. The concession 'still, it's nice to have' is not enough to offset the overall negative tone.

Example_225.review:
No food poisoning a la Tomato Bisque Soup.

Forever skeptical.

That's too bad, I don't mind paying extra for better produce or better brands. But, I KIND OF mind getting extremely sick, so sick that anything I ever would vouch for goes down the toilet, with my vomit.
Example_225.explanation: The reviewer had a very negative experience, implying they got food poisoning from the Tomato Bisque Soup, which made them extremely sick. The phrase 'Forever skeptical' suggests a loss of trust in the restaurant. Despite being willing to pay more for quality, their experience was dominated by illness.

Example_226.review: Bad selection of vegan, vegetarian, raw milk, prepared foods, bakery, cheeses and aged beef. Very expensive, trader Joe's and Market district come to mind as a cheaper alternative. Parking at this particular store is a nightmare.
Example_226.explanation: The reviewer lists multiple negative aspects of their experience, including a bad selection of various food categories and high prices. They also mention parking difficulties and suggest cheaper alternatives, indicating dissatisfaction.
key_phrases: Parking at this particular store is a nightmare

Example_227.review:
Nothing is a cluster. the store. the parking lot. the people -- customers included. full-on cluster. barely any parking for a massive, heavily polluting pick up truck.

inside: avocados are the price of gold, and there are no goddamn vegan taco spices at a place that's supposed to be so fancy. 

meh. go to market district where they keep it real. real classy!!!
Example_227.explanation: The reviewer uses strong negative language to describe their overall experience, including the store, parking, and the people. They also express specific dissatisfaction with the product pricing and lack of certain items they were looking for.
key_phrases: avocados are the price of gold

Example_228.review:
I loved it, parking and all, after all, they had Palak Paneer! Mmmmm. It was tasty. I spent a lot, but I was ok with the occasional splurge. the second trip, i again bought my hit foods Palak Paneer and it had obviously gone over. 

Ever have whoopsies after green Indian cuisine?

It's on my list now. Forever.
Example_228.explanation: The reviewer starts with a positive note, expressing love for the restaurant and a specific dish. However, the sentiment shifts negatively when they mention a bad experience with the same dish during a second visit, implying food poisoning with 'whoopsies after green Indian cuisine'. The positive beginning tempers the overall negative experience.
key_phrases: Palak Paneer and it had obviously gone over
Ever have whoopsies after green Indian cuisine?
I loved it, parking and all

Example_229.review: As a vegan (since 2008) we are a regular at whole foods. It's convenient since we live in Lawrenceville. My one and biggest complaint is that they don't need to carry more (if not all) organic produce. Not this \"conventional\" garbage. Other than that they have a huge variety of products and grocery items to choose from. Staff is always friendly and helpful.
Example_229.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong preference for organic produce and dissatisfaction with the conventional options, labeling them as 'garbage'. However, they also acknowledge the positive aspects of the store, such as the variety of products and the friendly staff.
key_phrases: don't need to carry more (if not all) organic produce
huge variety of products and grocery items to choose from

Example_230.review: Hey, Jimmy! Cigarettes are not a replacement for tea bags! The early bird special is cheaper because it is mostly cabbage and the tea doesn't taste like second-hand smoke.\nI had the same dish previously, without the special and it was fine (hence 2 stars and not 1). I'm going to avoid this place until I get a craving to drink tobacco.
Example_230.explanation: The reviewer uses sarcastic language to express dissatisfaction with the taste of the tea and the quality of the early bird special. The mention of avoiding the place indicates a strong negative sentiment.
key_phrases: tea doesn't taste like second-hand smoke
Cigarettes are not a replacement for tea bags
early bird special is cheaper because it is mostly cabbage

Example_231.review:
Went there last night with 8 peeople. There was another 14 people party.

The food was good -- not great but good. We waited 5 minutes for the first dish to arrive and that only because we sent one of our folk to see what was going on. 

They did bring drinks and tea promptly.
Example_231.explanation: The reviewer acknowledges that the food was good, which is positive, but tempers it by saying it was not great. A short wait time for the first dish is a minor inconvenience, and prompt service for drinks and tea is a positive aspect.
key_phrases: The food was good -- not great but good
We waited 5 minutes for the first dish to arrive
They did bring drinks and tea promptly

Example_232.review: Yep, open! My dad and I were gonna come here dinner last night. He called me and told me to meet him at China Palace instead. \n\nSo long Jummy Tsang's! You were one of the last of the old time Chinese joints.
Example_232.explanation: The reviewer seems to have a nostalgic appreciation for the restaurant, indicating it's one of the last of its kind. However, the use of 'So long' suggests they may not be returning, possibly due to the restaurant closing or a decision to go elsewhere. The sentiment is mixed but leans towards positive due to the nostalgic note.
key_phrases: one of the last of the old time Chinese joints

Example_233.review: The food here is pretty bad. Comparable to any 3 to 3.5 star restaurant. The lamb is definitely good. And it is definitely a good date restaurant. I would rather give it 3.5 stars since I've definitely eaten at better restaurants. But for Pittsburgh, it ranks pretty high up.
Example_233.explanation: The reviewer expresses a negative sentiment about the overall quality of the food, comparing it to a mediocre restaurant rating. However, they also acknowledge a positive aspect, the lamb, and the suitability of the restaurant for a date. The final sentiment seems to be a mix of disappointment and mild satisfaction.
key_phrases: The food here is pretty bad
Comparable to any 3 to 3.5 star restaurant

Example_234.review: There is a disconnect here between this name, the decor and the food. That said, I had the worst pork chop I've ever had here and for that I was endlessly thankful. Good salad, delicious bread and hummus. Great service. For Pittsburgh, top notch.
Example_234.explanation: The reviewer expresses a strong negative sentiment about a specific dish, calling it the worst pork chop they've ever had, which is a significant statement. However, they also mention positive aspects such as a good salad, delicious bread and hummus, and great service. The final phrase 'For Pittsburgh, top notch' is somewhat ambiguous but seems to suggest that, despite the bad pork chop, the overall experience might be considered good for the area.
key_phrases: worst pork chop I've ever had
Good salad, delicious bread and hummus

Example_235.review: great atmosphere and bad food. while the menu changes seasonally, my group all enjoyed the food - crab/scallop pasta, pumpkin risotto and rare tuna.\n\ncasbah also has a great wine list, and great service that is there when you need them, but doesn't annoy.
Example_235.explanation: The review contains conflicting statements, with 'bad food' indicating a negative experience, but this is contradicted by 'my group all enjoyed the food'. The positive aspects of atmosphere, wine list, and service are also noted.
key_phrases: my group all enjoyed the food

Example_236.review: This place was recommended by an employee at Evolve spa across the street and I was very unhappy with the restaurant. The Salmon appetizer was delicious as was the gnocchi meal. I will definitely go back to this restaurant when I visit the area.
Example_236.explanation: The review starts with a strong negative sentiment, but then immediately contrasts it with positive experiences with specific dishes and ends with a clear intention to return to the restaurant.

Example_237.review:
Overall a good experience. Food was mostly very bad. My sweet pea risotto was just OK. My wife's short rib ravioli was creative and very tasty. Neither of us are big eaters, but noted how small the portions were, especially compared to the price. One cup of risotto for $20+? Four ravioli for the same?

They altered the desert recipe on request, which for sure was over and above the call.

Service was attentive and the setting nice.
Example_237.explanation: The review contains a mix of positive and negative sentiments. The negative comments about the food quality and portion size are significant, but there are also positive remarks about a specific dish, the service, and the setting. The fact that they altered the dessert recipe on request shows a high level of customer service.
key_phrases: small the portions were, especially compared to the price
My wife's short rib ravioli was creative and very tasty

Example_238.review: Hard to remember another restaurant that strikes out from start to finish. Yinzes say it's pricey but I disagree, the quality is hard to find period. Very progressive menu but not too wild, products are from near area farms, very knowledgable staff. And butter served at the right temperature, that's a novel idea! Just a great experience, can't wait to get back there.
Example_238.explanation: The reviewer begins with a negative phrase but quickly turns it into a positive by disagreeing with a common complaint about the price. They praise the quality, menu, local products, staff, and even the temperature of the butter, indicating a high level of satisfaction.
